224001.name: Northern Moat: Wargames rules to recreate naval warfare on the Great Lakes in the War of 1812
224001.description:
Wargames rules to simulate naval warfare on the Great Lakes in the War of 1812.

Fast play rules for Napoleonic period naval warfare - which Napoleon had nothing to do with! While Britain and France fought a bitter war to decide the future of Europe, across the Atlantic another war was being fought, borne of American ambition and British disdain. On the long wilderness border between the United States and British North America, hardy frontiersmen and colonial militia hacked fleets out of the virgin forest, fleets to contest the Great Lakes, fleets to decide the future of a continent.


Includes the historical background to the war.
A description of the main campaigns on all three main theatres.
Detailed rulebook and ready ref sheet.
Examples of play.
Ship cards for all warships known to have been active in the conflict (Note these are also sold separately, but this full rules set includes all ship detail sheets).
Bonus scenario: the battle of Put-in-bay.

224002.name: Bedlam Depths
224002.description:
From the introduction:

Bedlam Depths is a small chunk of a much larger whole. It is a game created based off of Manastorm, and takes place in Manastorm’s world of Paragon. In Bedlam Depths, you’ll be able to play and explore the entirety of the cave system and kill the monsters and bosses that are indigenous to it.

Bedlam Depths has all of the basic elements of Manastorm, but it is not recommended to use it as your rulebook, as it only contains a small portion of what you need to experience all of Manastorm or all of Paragon. You may craft your character based on whatever ideals you wish, and your alignment is irrelevant. In the eyes of the people, your reputation is the only thing you’ll be remembered by.

224003.name: Foul Deeds Done
224003.description:
From the introduction:

A talent show turns deadly as an evil wizard seemingly bent on revenge kidnaps a noble’s son. Foul Deeds Done will see adventurers track this villainous mage to his lair and assault his tower. Once there, however, they will find not everything is as it seems...

User summary:

For 5th level characters.

224004.name: A Chance Encounter
224004.description:
From the introduction:

The adventure starts as the players are traveling upon the Talbet road during a beautiful spring morning. The sun is out and the birds are singing their spring songs. As the morning passes they see black smoke rising from beyond a hill the road goes around.

User summary:

For 1st level characters. The scenario is distributed with two separate map files in JPG format.

224005.name: A Bone to Pick
224005.description:
From the introduction:

The player characters have decided to take a young half-elf Erroll up on an adventuring job offer of freeing a nearby settlement of a secret necromantic tyrant. The players are due to arrive in Grandalton the night before the town’s third year anniversary. Errol has no idea about the celebration, and thanks to arriving in the middle of the night, the players’ only hints are the decorative banners on buildings and bridges in town.

User summary:

For 1st - 2nd level characters.

224006.name: Storm Warning
224006.description:
From the introduction:

It’s been six months since the 3rd Grandalversary Celebration. Fall is in full swing on the Sword Coast, with the first frost due any day now. The party is hanging out in The Weary Squire, enjoying the warm atmosphere and company while, outside, a storm builds up. You’re engaged in a rather boring but informative conversation with Grandalton’s banker Hormstein Myst.

User summary:

For 1st - 2nd level characters.

224007.name: Seeds of Doom
224007.description:
From the introduction:

Ivellie Susserence, a druid initiate of the local Circle of Grassland, was assigned to work with farmer Karrot to help his harvest this season. Ivellie purchased Seeds of Plenty from a woman who she met in the High Forest forest west of town. However, when she planted them the seeds filled the whole field full of noxious weeds in a matter of days. The weeds spilled out of their original field and are threatening to takeover nearby farms as well.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters.

224008.name: Crystal City
224008.description:
From the introduction:

A glittering futuristic city has appeared immediately east of Grandalton overnight. The entire city and it’s inhabitants are illusory. The denizens look and sound like true humanoids, but lack physical being or any smell. They have no memory of Grandalton and think they and their city have always been here.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters.

224009.name: The Sisters Three
224009.description:
From the introduction:

A magical artifact belonging to Idris the Wild has been stolen from Grandalton and for once Odd didn’t do it. The artifact, a bag of magical beans, was stolen by a coven of green hags. The three sisters hid the treasure away in a chest with arcane lock cast on it once by each of them from a set of magical keys to keep it safe while the heat from Idris was on.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters.

224010.name: Medical Frontier
224010.description: In Medical Frontier, players play medicine-developing researchers, and their mission is to distribute their own budget on different drug development projects to make new drugs. Players need to ensure the new drugs are safe and efficient in treating diseases, while keeping the side effects at controllable levels. Once you meet all of these marketing approval requirements, the new drugs can be launched. Will you save people's lives while making most profits for your lab?

224011.name: Gold Armada
224011.description:
Gold Armada is a irate themed board game where players roll the dice and try to collect as many gold coins as possible! The better you roll, the more difficult it is to collect more coins. Successful rolls are rewarded with gold, but unsuccessful rolls will earn you a skull token.

Each turn the player rolls 5 dice and tries to match a certain set of symbols on the game boards. He can reroll any number of dice twice. Depending on the final result, he can pick up 1 coin in a row that matches a set of symbols on his dice. When picking up a coin, a new symbol becomes visible, making the current row harder, but also more rewarding as the value of the coins increase.

If the player fails to roll any set of symbols, he has to pick up a skull coin, which gives him -1 points for each coin at the end of the game.

The game ends when all gold coins are picked up or when a player takes the last skull coin. Count the value of all your gold coins and substract any skull coins. The player who has the most points wins the game!

224012.name: Ramasjang Rally
224012.description:
A classical memory game in a fun and different version.

The theme of the game is soapbox car racing, where the player race to be the first across the finishing line.

All 20 tiles lay with their back up, just like in memory, but in this game you do not have to find 2 alike tiles. You do have to find the tile corresponding to the space in front of you on the track.

If you do turn over the correct tile, you move your car forwards, and can continue turning over tiles until you turn over a tile that does not match.

In the box:
1 Board
20 Tiles
4 Soapbox cars (cardboard tiles)
Very simple Danish rulebook

224013.name: Mini Park
224013.description:
Citizens await the completion of a new park, and the players are architects tasked with its design. Be it building a playground for children to play on, installing benches for people to rest after a long day's work, planting trees where birds perch, sculpting a lake where fishes swim, or growing bushes where cats can hide in, players are responsible for planning the layout of the park.

Mini Park is a tile-laying board game. On their turns, players randomly draw different types of installation tiles, then build the park according to placement rules. Meanwhile, players must also seize opportunities to place characters onto corresponding park installations and score points. When the park is completed, the player with the most points wins.

224015.name: Tid til tal
224015.description:
This game is designed for use in primary school, but is also suitable fort originally to play with numbers at home.

The idea behind the game is that when the child playing and having fun, then it is also easier to learn. Therefore, in these games emphasized that it should be both fun and educational at the same time.

Game contains 12 different small games like memory game, where combining "actual numbers" with "number of dots" on the tiles. Dice rolling with addition and/or subtraction. The game focuses on getting familiar with numbers and light addition and subtractions

224016.name: Leg Lær Læs
224016.description:
Leg Lær Læs focuses on the 120 most frequently occurring words in the Danish language. Today it is widely recognized that children who master these words are far easier to learn to read and write.

The game consists of 16 small games and game with increasing difficulty that all strengthens children's language comprehension and increase their reading speed. Leg Lær Læs use different learning styles, so there are games and games for both children who would like to sit still, and those who want to move while they have fun learning.

224017.name: The Cat Games
224017.description:
Do you like cats? Then this is the purrfect game for you!

'The Cat Games' include three main games:

*Indoor Racing: Take on an obstacle course using all your reflexes and dexterity.
* Swim Challenge: Test your reaction time and keep a cool (and dry) head.
* Cat Breed Billiards: Challenge your intelligence and knowledge of cat breeds.

There are also several mini games for achievement hunters. You still hunt, don't you?

Source: The Game Website.

224018.name: Victory's Vault Volume 2, Issue 06
224018.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Every Item Touched by Victory!"

The "good" Miss Cindy Wondderra claims to be the keeper of the vaults of a Corporation that deals solely in Victory, and in the pages of Victory's Vault, she offers these items to adventurers and villains alike at remarkable prices! Each installment of Victory's Vaults includes...

A fine selection of weapons of the Era
A unique item of armor
A vehicle the suit the needs of hero and/or villain
A "white elephant," such as a new animal, a playable Package, some new Special Abilities, or a place to explore and perhaps purchase!




Also includes some notes on how Miss Wonderra pitches these fine items, and the potential benefits (or consequences!) of haggling. Want more stuff? You can't do much better than to look in Victory's Vault!

224019.name: Monster of the Month #1: Basajuan (5E)
224019.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month brings to life a new monster from ancient folklore every single month for both Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Created using actual folklore gathered by Justin Andrew Mason then expertly illustrated by AAW Games' lead artist Mates Laurentiu (Romania), the monsters are then crafted by Stephen Rowe (Pathfinder RPG) and Chris Harris (5th Edition).

A hulking bipedal figure approaches. It is redolent of pungent musk. Lumbering nearly seven feet tall, the being might be mistaken for a very large human if not for a scant coat of fur. Dark hair (and tangled beard) contrast with its ruddy verdant-toned flesh. The creature moves with cunning and deliberate swagger whilst outfitted with a primitive hide loincloth and crude stone-knapped weaponry. Its wide eyes narrow as its attention focuses on every movement. A dissonance of short grunts call out as it dons an offensive posture.

The basajaun is a caveman like woodland dweller from Basque mythology. The creature was considered to be a protector of livestock, and a teacher to early humans. Legends suggest that the basajaun introduced humans to agriculture, and taught them how to cultivate nature to their advantage. Its name can be loosely translated to mean “Lord of the Forest” and is said to have dwelled within the Pyrenees Mountains. A natural enemy of wolves, the basajaun often befriended shepherds and offered protection to their flocks. Their innate connection as nature spirits also made them privy to the natural world, and distant thunder could be construed as the warning cries of basajaun warning of an approaching storm. Interestingly, some fringe theories suggest that the mythical creature known as the basajaun may actually be a vestigial memories of early Human encounters with Neanderthal, as the Iberian Peninsula from which the myth hails was also one of the last locales the species inhabited before going extinct.

224020.name: Monster of the Month #1: Basajuan (Pathfinder)
224020.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month brings to life a new monster from ancient folklore every single month for both Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition and the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Created using actual folklore gathered by Justin Andrew Mason then expertly illustrated by AAW Games' lead artist Mates Laurentiu (Romania), the monsters are then crafted by Stephen Rowe (Pathfinder RPG) and Chris Harris (5th Edition).

224021.name: Pharaoh's Tomb
224021.description:
From publisher blurb:

No time to whip up a pyramid dungeon battle map? No problem! Here's your solution!

Complete with an exterior battle map and the 3 levels of the pyramid's interior. Each is a large, full concept battle map, including bare room and gridded versions. Also included is a customizable map tile set so that you may design your own layouts.

But that's not all! As a bonus, you also get item tiles!

A total of 40 Maps and Tiles. Just add monsters!

224022.name: The Necromancer
224022.description:
From publisher blurb:

The bad news is, you're dead. The good news is that you're taking it pretty well.

You awake as a specter, marked with deaths touch. You don't remember much about your previous existance, but you do know all there is to know about death. You raise your hand, and watch as the energies of the dead move to your whim. You make corpses dance, commune with spirits, and eat souls for breakfast.

The Necromancer is a new and complete playbook for Dungeon World, bask in necrotic energies, summon hordes of undead to do your bidding and create dark golems with your power!

224023.name: New Recruits: A Super Kids Adventure
224023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Encounters: 5
Difficulty: Normal
Duration: 90+ Minutes

Capital City needs superheroes. The police are kept busy dealing with all sorts of problems. Criminals, monsters, aliens, and super villains pose constant threats. This is a city that can use all the help it can get. That’s where super kids come in!

This adventure takes place at the Linwood Academy for Extraordinary Children. The characters are at Linwood being tested for admission into this prestigious school. The school serves as a training ground for super kids. The principal has devised a series of combat challenges and a riddle to assess whether the kids are worthy of further training and missions.

Compatibility and Conversion. While designed for Super Kids — a superhero expansion for Hero Kids — this adventure is fully compatible with all Hero Kids’ products. Hero Kids’ characters, including those from the space expansion, can be used. Game Masters might want to make minor changes to the adventure text to capture a medieval or space setting.

224024.name: Choe Pho 1st Level Nekomata Monk Pre-generated Character
224024.description:
From publisher blurb:

This download contains a pre-generated 1st Level Nekomata Monk character for use with Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy. The Choe Pho 1st Level Pre-generated Nekomata Monk includes one full version of the two-page sheet and one "printer-friendly" version with fewer graphics.

Also included is an editable version of the .pdf for personalization or leveling up!

224025.name: Choe Pho 1st Level Tengu Cleric Pre-generated Character
224025.description:
From publisher blurb:

This download contains a pre-generated 1st Level Tengu Cleric character for use with Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy. The Choe Pho 1st Level Pre-generated Tengu Cleric includes one full version of the two-page sheet and one "printer-friendly" version with fewer graphics.

Also included is an editable version of the .pdf for personalization or leveling up!

224026.name: Choe Pho 1st Level Slytherine Warlock Pre-generated Character
224026.description:
From publisher blurb:

This download contains a pre-generated 1st Level Slytherine Warlock character for use with Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy. The Choe Pho 1st Level Pre-generated Slytherine Warlock includes one full version of the two-page sheet and one "printer-friendly" version with fewer graphics.

Also included is an editable version of the .pdf for personalization or leveling up!

224027.name: Index of Insanity: New Madnesses
224027.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maladies of the Mind

Madnesses, a new affliction introduced in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: GameMastery Guide, and refined in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Horror Adventures, provide a way for GMs to assault a character’s sanity and self-control, in addition to the more physical threats that many adventurers face. There are many kinds of madness, however, and those books sampled only a few. This book presents 10 new madnesses to inflict upon player characters, including the following:

Blackout rage, which drives characters to fits of uncontrollable violence that they do not recall.
Crawling pain, a phantom sensation of crawling insects beneath the skin.
Dwarf greed, an all-consuming lust for material wealth.
Insomnia, driving characters to remain awake far beyond their body’s limitations.
Wendigo sickness, a powerful compulsion to consume the flesh of sentient creatures.




…and many more.

224028.name: Treasury of the City
224028.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic of Sewer, Street, and Throne!

The city is a dangerous place, and adventurers daring to brave the urban jungle need the right equipment! Treasury of the City brings you three dozen brand-new magic items perfect for every part of the city, from the back alleys, sewers, and slums, to the halls of power and the smoke-filled back rooms where power brokers rule from the shadows. You’ll find weapons and combat accessories like the toxic scabbard and forgetful sap alongside protective devices like cryptwarden’s plate and the roofrunner’s buckler. Delvers into the dank byways beneath the city will love ratty robes and the sewer suit, while those accustomed to high places will love the lecturer’s staff, senator’s stole, and the scale of endless bureaucracy! Criminals will find handy devices like pilferer’s gloves and the cheater’s hat, while officers of the law wield the mark of the authority, nightwatch crossbow, and the inspector’s bullhorn to bring them to justice! Wherever your heroes venture in adventures of urban intrigue, they’ll find the perfect tools to take down treacherous advisers and bring justice to the streets.

224029.name: Sensational Sentai Squad GO!
224029.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Sentai” () -- team, military task force, squadron. In 1975 Toei Productions created a tokusatsu (special effects) TV show featuring a team of costumed heroes called “Himitsu Sentai Gorenger”, or “Secret Team Go-Ranger”, spawning a series that would be in constant production for over 40 years. The formula is simple: a group of friends from all walks of life is united as a sentai in multi-colored costumes to oppose an Earch-shattering threat. In each episode the threats grow, from fighting faceless minions, to meeting the lieutenant, a parade of monsters each week, culminating in a final battle with the big bad itself.

Now you can join that proud tradition. Choose your team mates, choose your favorite primary color, choose an awsome team theme, and become a Sensational Sentai Squad! GO!!!

"Sensational Sentai Squad GO!" features rules for creating a tight-knit team of powerful rangers, multiple campaign ideas, and a complete starting adventure set in the ever-expanding world of Mecha vs Kaiju.

"Links" offer a way of connecting characters closely during the Phase Trio, then continuing the evolution of their relationship during play.
The "Sentai Stunt" turns any character into a super hero, complete with a list of "Sentai Fighting Moves" for every skill (and I do mean every).
Four sample settings complete with Campaign Notes, including how to turn MvK mecha and kaiju stunts into super powers and introducing alien races into your campaign.
"The Kannon Sentai", a complete introductory adventure inspired by ancient Japanese history, taking place within the established MvK mythology of the battle between the heavenly Kami and the diobolical Ogres.

224030.name: Peregrination
224030.description:
From publisher blurb:

The exciting artifact series concludes with AS3 – Peregrination. With a pair of control rods in hand you are guided to an ultimate prize, a Gnomish flying vessel! The rods have directed you to a crashed ship buried in the sandy beach. A check of the debris sheds light on the mystery of the artifact and a description of how to repair the intricate machine. Apparently finding the vessel is just the start!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D in the Filbar Artifact Series for a 4-8 adventurers of 8th – 12th level and a DM.

224031.name: Cartagena
224031.description:
Cartagena takes as its theme the famous 1672 pirate-led jailbreak from the fortress of Cartagena. Each player has a group of six pirates, and you want to be the first to have all six escape through the tortuous underground passage that connects the fortress to the port, where a sloop is waiting for them.

To move a pirate, you need to play a card from your hand. Each card bears one of six symbols (gun, rum, parrot, etc.), and when you play a card, you move one of your pirates forward to the next matching symbol in the tunnel, leapfrogging over matching symbols where another pirate already stands. The only way to get more cards, however, is to move backwards; more specifically, you move one of your pirates backwards to the first space that holds one or two pirates, drawing one or two cards after doing so. Each turn, you take 1-3 actions, whether moving forward or backward or both. When you move a pirate to the end of the track, it jumps on the sloop where it must await the other pirates in its crew. With every step toward victory, though, you have fewer and fewer pirates to move each turn, possibly locking you in to actions you don't want, so be sure to plan ahead and not leave yourself empty-handed!

This version of Cartagena includes the classic base game mixed with Cartagena 2. The Pirate's Nest and several new variants. The game includes eight double-sided game boards, and to play the base game you use only six of them. Use more boards for a longer game, or fewer boards (and possibly fewer pirates) for a shorter game. To replicate Cartagena 2, you can flip over three or more of the game boards to create a secondary path that's separate from the first one. Now when you place pirates in the sloop, you can use an action to move the sloop to the start of the second path — and with two paths, you have a harder time making huge jumps from start to finish.

"Morgan" is a variant in which players can now draw cards by moving an opponent's pirate ahead, drawing one or two cards when the pirate stops at the first space that contains one or two pirates; this variant and all others can be used in any version of the game. With the "Filibusters" variant, whenever someone plays one of the twelve cards with a dark background, everyone other than the active player must discard until they have at most seven cards in hand.

Finally, the "Black Magic Woman" variant introduces special powers to the six symbols on the card, and when you play a card, you can use it for pirate movement like normal or use the card' power. You can play two parrots as if they were any other symbol, or use a lantern to look at the top four cards and keep one of your choice. With the gun, you steal a card of your choice from an opponent's hand, with them getting one free draw in return. The treasure chest symbol lets you pick up the treasure chest from the space where you stand, most likely drawing cards from the deck as a bonus, but possibly suffering a snakebite that will have you running back for rum to help you forget the pain!

224032.name: Torc of the Blood Kings (ICONS)
224032.description:
From publisher blurb:

A treasure hunter has uncovered a powerful, arcane artifact that was best left buried! Now, unwillingly transforming into a violent mutant overlord, he poses a dangerous dilemma to the heroes: will they let him suffer the consequences of his actions, or face the ire of the Blood Kings upon themselves?

This adventure was created for heroes using ICONS Assembled Edition.

224033.name: Malek Gyre (M&M3)
224033.description:
From publisher blurb:

Malek Gyre is a space cop gone bad. He was one of the best and brightest in the interstellar police force called the Ghostlight Centurions.

But now - he's fallen from grace, gone rogue and is ready to cause trouble in your next M&M3e games.

224034.name: Munchkin Halloween Monster Box
224034.description: The Munchkin Halloween Monster Box has room for two thousand Munchkin cards, various Kill-O-Meters, a Level Playing Field or two, Dungeons, Seals, and more. To get you started, it includes twelve holiday-themed Munchkin cards that you can shuffle into any game

224035.name: Zombie Dice Horde Edition
224035.description:
Eat brains. Don't get shotgunned.

In Zombie Dice, you are a zombie. You want braaains – more brains than any of your zombie buddies. The 13 custom dice are your victims. Push your luck to eat their brains, but stop rolling before the shotgun blasts end your turn! Whoever collects 13 brains first wins. Each game takes 10 to 20 minutes and can be taught in a single round.

Each turn, you take three dice from the box and roll them. A brain symbol is worth one point at the end of the round, while footsteps allow you to reroll this particular dice. Shotgun blasts on the other hand are rather bad, cause if you collect three shotgun blasts during your turn, it is over for you and you get no points. After rolling three dice, you may decide if you want to score your current brain collection or if you want to push your luck by grabbing new dice so you have three again and roll once more.

Zombie Dice Horde Edition includes the Zombie Dice base game, as well as the Zombie Dice 2: Double Feature and Zombie Dice 3: School Bus expansions, along with a cloth bag and a scorepad to keep track of those tasty brains.

224036.description:
Contains five plastic Chieftain Main Battle Tanks, two plastic two Lynx helicopters, six resin tank commander figures, eight rare-earth magnets, two decal sheets, six unit cards and one printed cardboard Artillery & Salvo template.

C Squadron, 17th/21st Lancers, and the Irish Guardsmen supporting them made their last-minute preparations, each man checking his weapons one more time and going through the little rituals that had become talismans against violent death.

After days of hard fighting, they were worn and frayed, no longer so eager to test themselves in battle. Their expressions were grim and hard. The coming battle was not going to be easy.
224036.name: Team Yankee: Charlie's Chieftains – British Armored Squadron

boardgameintegration: Codenames
Codenames
224037.description:
Codenames Duet keeps the basic elements of Codenames — give one-word clues to try to get someone to identify your agents among those on the table — but now you're working together as a team to find all of your agents. (Why you don't already know who your agents are is a question that Congressional investigators will get on your back about later!)

To set up play, lay out 25 word cards in a 5×5 grid. Place a key card in the holder so that each player sees one side of the card. Each player sees a 5×5 grid on the card, with nine of the squares colored green (representing your agents) and one square colored black (representing an assassin). The assassin is in different places on each side of the card, and three of the nine squares on each side are also green on the other side!

Collectively, you need to reveal all fifteen agents — without revealing either assassin or too many innocent bystanders — before time runs out in order to win the game. Either player can decide to give a one-word clue to the other player, along with a number. Whoever receives the clue places a finger on a card to identify that agent. If correct, they can attempt to identify another one. If they reveal as many as the number stated by the clue-giver, then they can take one final guess, if desired. If they identify a bystander, then their guessing time ends. If they identify an assassin, you both lose!
224037.name: Codenames Duet

224038.name: Lookee: The Clue-Solving Scavenger Hunt Card Game
224038.description:
Lookee is a new spin on the scavenger hunt. It allows kids to have fun and learn critical thinking skills at the same time.  The object of the Lookee game is for player(s) to solve clues, the answer to those clues provides player(s) with information about where to find their next clue. You decide how many clues and where the adventure takes the player.  Lookee can be played as a single player, team or multi-player game. Lay out separate “paths” of clues for multiple players, or have everyone work together to solve the same path and win as a group!

Directions

• Determine how many clues and locations your scavenger hunt adventure will have.
• Choose one card to be the “Starting” point.
• Layout the cards based on the answers to the clues; for example, if the answer to the clue is the refrigerator, the next clue should be placed in, on or near the refrigerator.
• Once you’ve placed all your clue cards, direct player(s) to the “Starting” Point. Give player(s) the first clue and send them on their way.

Have ideas for your own clues? Lookee also includes blank cards, so you can write your own. Have fun and get creative!

224039.name: Farsight
224039.description:
Set in a grim future, Farsight immerses players in a world where powerful Private Military Corporations fight viciously over the Earth’s last remaining resources.

Developed over 8 years, Farsight is an attempt to bring in-depth wargaming to the table in a way that is elegant, accessible, and easy to engage with.

Each turn, players deploy units face-down to the battlefield, revealing them when they are spied upon, or enter combat. On a parallel 'Shadow Map,' hidden specialists are deployed to help spy on the enemy, sabotage their units and help shift the course of the game.

As the corporations battle for control of the field, events ranging from weather to deadly plagues will encourage players to change their strategies as the game goes on. The first player to capture 8 of 12 areas, or the 3 areas closest to their opponent, claims victory.

224041.name: More Aggressive Attitudes: The 1862 Virginia Campaign
224041.description:
Major General John Pope took command of the new Army of Virginia, and he wanted to bring a more aggressive posture to the Federal command. When Stonewall Jackson's Confederate wing moved north around the Union flank, Pope seized the opportunity to attack and attempt to destroy Jackson's force. Robert E. Lee, in overall command of the southern army in the area, had no intention of sitting passively. He aggressively sent Longstreet's wing to unite with Jackson, hoping to disrupt the US forces and commit to battle on favorable terms, even though the northerners had superior numbers. A number of battles were fought during this campaign, including the major battle of Second Bull Run.

More Aggressive Attitudes is an operational-level game for two players exploring the 1862 Virginia Campaign. Each hex represents a span of five miles, and each turn is a day. The counter density is low - just a handful of units per side - and the rules are simple, but nuanced. The focus is squarely on the operational level, and the ability of your subordinates to carry out your orders - to march a given distance in a day, to avoid battle, or to coordinate their attacks - is not entirely within your control. This uncertainty is simulated by a series of die rolls. (Don't worry about "wristage"; in practice, it's only a few rolls per turn.)

A number of chromey bits effortlessly recreate the particulars of this campaign without ever getting in the way of your decision-making and agency. The result is a compelling operational sandbox for gamers both old and new.

224042.name: Min-Max Monsters
224042.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to spice up your encounters? Min-Max Monsters is a treatise on finding and unlocking the potential of your favorite creatures. Chalk full of suggestions for both novice and experienced DMs, this book will provide you with new ideas for use in your games. While there are a handful of suggested new rules, they are not the focus of the book, nor are any new rules required to use the vast majority of the treatise. Rather, a careful look has been taken at the existing rules in fifth edition D&D so you can start putting them all to use.

Enjoy putting the hurt on your players in fun, new, and exciting ways. Take a look!

224043.name: Mazes & Minotaurs Miscellanea
224043.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the M&M MISCELLANEA, a mighty, 28-page supplement for Mazes & Minotaurs, jam-packed with all sorts of new options to expand your M&M campaign, including:

Three new character classes: the Pankratiast martial artist, the Sacred Healer and the Assassin
New options for unarmed combat and feats of marksmanship
Rules for tricking and deceiving monsters and other opponents
An optional Fate points system
New tricks for Elemental magicians
No less than THREE variant character advancement systems

224044.name: The Claws of Madness (Pathfinder)
224044.description:
From publisher blurb:

What Sinister Tidings Are Afloat?

The Claws of Madness is an adventure compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, carefully designed for a group of 1st-level heroes, including new monsters, magic items, and a thrilling story arc. Edited by Michele Carter (co-editor of the 5th Edition Player’s Handbook), this dungeon crawl combines the best elements of classic adventures with fresh new exciting avenues. The story in this book also provides the perfect base for an epic, long-running campaign suitable for higher-level characters, in which the heroes unravel the dark mystery of the mythical Hand of Narkul . . .

For centuries, Aelmor Monastery near the port town of Sestone was a safe haven for scholars, monks, and pilgrims seeking enlightenment, its renowned library home to an enormous collection of ancient manuscripts, tomes, and peculiar writings. After suffering a devastating attack at the hands of a possessed monastery elder, Aelmor fell into ruin, its troubled past forgotten. When villagers start disappearing and turn up horribly mutated days later, fear takes a grip of Sestone. What sinister forces are at work? And to what end?

Exciting dungeon crawl with new monsters & magic items
Drop into any existing campaign, easy to modify
Perfect basis to build a long-running higher level campaign

224045.name: Skills List 2e
224045.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Skills List for the second edition update of the 2d6 science fiction system reference document (2e 2d6 SF SRD) is the foundation of the Universal Machine core mechanic. This simple, two column, two page document comes in Word, Open and Rich Text file formats. A bonus formatted PDF gives you the skills list in the classic science fiction roleplaying game font and layout, giving a true Old School roleplaying look.

Universal Machine products integrate with other 2d6-based science fiction RPG systems, including the original 2d6 science fiction RPG modules and supplements. Universal Machine products can also be used seamlessly with Cepheus Engine materials.

224046.name: Skills List 1e
224046.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Skills List for the first edition of the 2d6 science fiction system reference document (1e 2d6 SF SRD) is the foundation of the Universal Machine core mechanic. This simple, two column, three page document comes in Word, Open and Rich Text file formats. A bonus formatted PDF gives you the skills list in the classic science fiction roleplaying game font and layout, giving a true Old School roleplaying look.

Universal Machine products integrate with other 2d6-based science fiction RPG systems, including the original 2d6 science fiction RPG modules and supplements. Universal Machine products can also be used seamlessly with Cepheus Engine materials.

224047.name: Skills List 2d6 SF SRD
224047.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the official core skills list for the Universal Machine 2d6 science fiction system reference document (2d6 SF SRD).

The 2d6 SF SRD Skills List is the foundation of the Universal Machine core mechanic. This simple, two column, three page document comes in Word, Open and Rich Text file formats. A bonus formatted PDF gives you the skills list in the classic science fiction roleplaying game font and layout, giving a true Old School roleplaying look. This Skills List can be replaced with either the 1e or the 2e Skills List, or a skills list of your own.

Universal Machine products integrate with other 2d6-based science fiction RPG systems, including the original 2d6 science fiction RPG modules and supplements. Universal Machine products can also be used seamlessly with Cepheus Engine materials.

224048.name: Advantage and Disadvantage 2e
224048.description:
From publisher blurb:

Advantage and Disadvantage for the 2d6 science fiction system reference document (2e 2d6 SF SRD) is a second edition update for the Universal Machine core mechanic. This simple, one column, one page document comes in Word, Open and Rich Text file formats. A bonus formatted PDF gives you the Advantage and Disadvantage rules in the classic science fiction roleplaying game font and layout, giving a true Old School roleplaying look.

Universal Machine products integrate with other 2d6-based science fiction RPG systems, including the original 2d6 science fiction RPG modules and supplements. Universal Machine products can also be used seamlessly with Cepheus Engine materials.

224049.name: Basic Character Generation
224049.description:
From publisher blurb:

Basic Character Generation is the starting point for your character!

The file contains everything you need to create your basic character before they begin their first career:

Definitions of the three characteristic types;
A description of each of characteristic;
A simple method for determining your character's intelligence quotient (IQ) score;
How to generate characteristic scores;
How to generate characteristic modifiers.

224050.name: Family Background
224050.description:
From publisher blurb:

Family Background continues developing your character!

The file contains everything you need to create your character's family background and events before they begin their first career:

Expanded description and rules for the Social Standing characteristic;
Step-by-step rules for generating your character's family background, stucture and relatives;
A d66 Family Events table.

224051.name: Graduate School
224051.description:
From publisher blurb:

Graduate School gives your character the chance for advanced academic development!

These files contain everything you need to create your character's time at gradauate school:

Rules for graduating, gaining skills and gaining honours when your character attends graduate school;
Drop Out and Events tables;
Education Debt rules and table.

224052.name: Physical Appearance
224052.description:
From publisher blurb:

Physical Appearance develops your character further!

The file contains everything you need to determine your character's physical appearance before they begin their first career:

A simple method for determining your character's height;
A simple method for determining your character's mass;
Simple methods for determining your character's skin, hair and eye colours.

224053.name: University
224053.description:
From publisher blurb:

University gives your character the chance for academic development!

These files contain everything you need to create your character's time at university:

Rules for graduating, gaining skills and gaining honours when your character attends university;
Drop Out and Events tables;
Education Debt rules and table.

224054.name: Chica Loca
224054.description:
An educational game about utilizing addition, multiplication, and number color matching. The game is played in rounds utilizing 5 cards in which each player must follow the color or number prior. At the end of each round the players add or multiply the cards in front of them and the one with the greatest sum is the winner. They are given a golden egg which are the victory points. The one with 3 or the predetermined number of golden eggs is the overall winner.

This is definitely a children's teaching game.

224055.name: A03 The Old Wood/A04 Chasing Kyzan
224055.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two 5E adventures in one! The evil necromancer Landis Kyzan has kidnapped some folk from the city of Wyld. A party of adventurers must track the wizard through the dangerous Old Wood. Then in the second adventure the party face Landis Kyzan in the strange ghost town of Myrr.

For character levels 4-6. This continues the Adventures in Myrr! A 55 page double adventure set in the World of Myrr.

Interesting NPCs
New Monsters
New Magic Items
Encounter tables and monster lists
Traps and Treasure

224056.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Zombie Manual II: Welcome to Zombie Land!
224056.description:
From publisher blurb:

SURVIVE THIS!! Zombies! - Zombie Manual II - Welcome to Zombie Land! features 7 New Zombie types: Bone Zombies, Mutated Bone Zombies (Special), Boss Zombies, Legend Zombies, Melting Zombies, Screamer Zombies and Zombie Children.

Also included is the Biker Scout Villian (Optional Character Class), 2 all new Survivor Sheets, Random Encounter Tables and more!

224058.name: Joking Hazard: Deck Enhancement #1
224058.description: The first expansion to Joking Hazard. Mix these 100 cards in with your Joking Hazard game for extra deck enhancement.

224060.name: Pigment
224060.description:
You are Master Painters of the Renaissance! ...Or you would be, if you had some paints!

Send your two Apprentices to gather and trade Pigments in the crowded and ever-evolving Bazaar for your works! Each Bazaar Card has two useful effects to choose from, but each Apprentice can only use one each turn.

Acquire Subjects to paint with your Pigments, and receive powerful Premier Piece Effects from the completed works!

Fill your gallery first to win!

~

Pigment is a fast, minimalist worker placement game for 2-3 players from Copper Frog Games LLC.

224064.name: Pacific War Naval Chess Game
224064.description: Pacific Ocean naval campaign Spring 1942 through Summer 1945 in 14 seasonal turns. Capital ships paired. Simple surface, submarine, and air combat mechanics any kid can quickly master. Magic intelligence in the early seasons - kamikazes in the later ones. VIOLENT little game is also somewhat unpredictable making it solitaire fare.

224066.name: Ouest Sauvage Colt Maudit
224066.description:
User summary:

Ouest Sauvage Colt Maudit presents quick start rules and a few concise introductory scenarios. Many of the rules are replaced with "ASCV" (Available Solely in Complete Version).

Originally written in French, the English-language translation is quite... difficult.

224067.name: Cyberworld (1-Page)
224067.description:
From the introduction:

Cyberworld is a cyberpunk game that fits on one page. Its simplicity allows for quick game creation and never gets in the way of storytelling. The Apocalypse World inspired the mechanics, and encourage creativity and continuous world building. But beware: bad rolls hold serious consequences!

Get some friends together, dust off your arsenal, and try not to botch the run.

224068.name: Delving Dungeons
224068.description:
User summary:

Delving Dungeons provides a relatively simple system to rapidly generate a random dungeon setting and populate it with opponents and treasure. This is done on an as-needed basis, typically during play, to provide an environment for solitaire roleplaying.

Most of the game document is intended for print-and-play use, and consists of full-color "cards".

224069.name: The Strivog - The Bone Drow
224069.description:
Publisher Blurb:

"All drow are alike, and the only good drow is a dead one."

Assume all drow are the same at your peril—especially in Porphyra! On the Patchwork Planet, dark elves were summoned from disparate and distant worlds, with entirely different origins, masters, and plans. Scattered across the Underdeep, the drow have thrived below and made secret forays into the lands above. They are ready to become tempting dreams and lurking nightmares anywhere, in any campaign that wants something more from drow than what you’ve seen before.

Each chapter in the drow of Porphyra focuses on one of the tribes, providing all of the following:

A brief history of the tribe on their home world and in recent nights
The hierarchies and divisions of their society, from nobles to guilds and beyond
Laws and punishments particular to the culture
Religious expectations, whether they follow one god or many or none
Goals for characters within their families, groups, cities, and nations
Notable cities and plot hooks for interacting with the tribe, from within or without
Methods common to their kind, whether they rely on raids or seduction or other guises
Racial and faction traits to help customize your characters from the base on up
Alternate systems and mechanics necessary for the tribe (and for evil or other campaigns)
Feats and equipment that are useful to have at hand
Details for creating player characters, allies, antagonists, and others with new depths
You never know what the next chapter will reveal, but together, the drow of Porphyra cover a powerful range of roleplaying experiences. Add one or all of them to your game now!

This volume follows the tale of the Strivog, who fled a dying world only to emerge on Porphyra infused with death in a whole new way. Having claimed magically glowing ice caverns in a remote corner of the Underdeep, they continue to build their empire with the corpses of their enemies and any other bodies they can claim. They take slaves, but also attract zealous vassals who serve until their last breaths of their own free will. They torture and torment, but maintain a cold distance and a brutal, simple efficiency. They destroy lives, but are dedicated to building objects that will outlast them. Because for the bone brow, death is the truth and the only reality worth preparing for.

Highlights of this chapter include:

A unique system for character options and advancement
Changes to Craft, Profession, and Perform categories
Rules for building items that are imbued with the strengths of fallen foes
A selection of Necromancy spells that showcase how the Strivog operate

224070.name: Light OSR Core
224070.description:
User summary:

Light OSR Core is a rules-light, two-page roleplaying game that emulates the "old school" dungeon delving experience with a minimal rule set. Character creation can be completed in a few minutes and play then proceeds in a standard fashion.

224071.name: Light OSR Character Sheet
224071.description:
User summary:

The Light OSR Character Sheet is designed for the game, but could be used with most "old school" games. It is intended for print-and-play use and features two character sheets per page.

224072.name: Blood and Sand:  The Gladiator Sourcebook
224072.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The fans cheer when you score a hit, and lay open a man’s breast with the well honed edge of your sword. The mob roars with laughter as a condemned heretic armed only with a child’s wooden sword dies beneath the fangs of a lion. The arena itself seems to tremble with excited shouts when you put your sandaled foot onto the neck of a defeated fellow gladiator, and lift your eyes and blade to the skyboxes, to learn whether you will spare or execute your defeated rival. Step onto the arena’s sand, still stinking of blood and spilt shit from the last match. Raise your sword high in salute to your master and the Emperor who commissioned these games. Size up your opponent, gauge the strength in his muscles, the flexibility in his limbs, his familiarity with the net and trident. Fight well, die with courage, and be remembered forever… or at least until a new champion wins the fickle hearts of the mob.

This sourcebook contains everything you need to create your own variations on your favorite gladiator adventures and characters. This sourcebook includes:

• History of Gladiators
• Specific Types of Gladiator matches including those with Bards, Clerics, Druids, Sorcerers, and Wizards
• Races of the Arena
• New Race: Nephilim
• Nearly 20 all new Gladiator feats including Acrobatic Gladiator, Footwork, and Slayer of Multitudes
• Ten Gladiator Magic Items including Actor’s Oil, Freeman’s Rudis, and Spellbinding Manacles
• Four new spells including Gladiator’s Virility and Will of the Crowd
• Adventure Site: The Coliseum Maximus

224073.name: No Horizon
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
224073.description:
Author's blurb:

Created as my final year project at Teesside University, No Horizon is a rules-light Sci-fi tabletop game where players play the role of a ships crew, as part of an organisation that collects and responds to distress signals throughout the galaxy.

In No Horizon, players choose between a selection of alien races and ship roles, customising their character with over 70 Advantages and Drawbacks, 40+ augmentations and gene therapies and a veritable armoury of equipment, guns and starships. Players can even tap into powerful energies and unleash devastating psychic abilities.

No Horizon's Arcs system ties a characters' narrative and mechanical progression together, rewarding players for roleplaying and developing their character with the vital Talent needed to spend on improving their skills and attributes.

224074.name: Horrific Fears
224074.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Games in the genre of dark fantasy and horror naturally work against some of the accepted assumptions of heroic fantasy. In a typical fantasy RPG game, combat might not be as dangerous and threatening in a fear- or horror-based adventure. The core hit point rules allow PCs to absorb a few attacks without disrupting their abilities. In contrast, most horror movies and stories are built with devastating, direct threats that can slay even the toughest hero with a single blow. Magic, monsters, and other facets of the core rules may not match the tone and feel that you want to induce in your horror or dark fantasy gaming session.

Horrific Fears presents a mixture of new options you can use to modify the core rules to make you gaming sessions fit the dark fantasy and horror better. This sourcebook is completely 100% open OGL content for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. This Horrific Terror: The Fear and Terror sourcebook presents quick, easy, and flexible system for incorporating the effects of fear, horror and in some cases, extreme madness into your fantasy game. Horrific Terror: The Fear and Terror sourcebook reminds players that hazardous adventures can bring all types of penalties and facilitate motivate role playing.

The Horrific Terror: The Fear and Terror sourcebook includes rules for:
The Template Approach to Fear and Horror
Character Health and Mortality
Constitution and Health System
Wound Levels and Injury Penalties
Rules for Fear, Terror, and Madness with Madness Points for Long-Term Insanity
...and much more

224075.name: The Drac Hack
224075.description:
From the introduction:

Creatures from your favorite Gothic horror adventure, for use with the brilliant The Black Hack.

User summary:

This product is supplied as two PDF documents - the 7-page sourcebook and a separate 1-page reference sheet.

224076.name: The Thousand Maw
224076.description:
Publisher Blurb:

DRAGON LORE is a new line of supplements for fans of The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game looking to enhance their campaigns. The Thousand Maw offers a new look at an old fantasy favorite, the orc.

"Orcs by their very nature are fearsome, brutish creatures who revel in dealing death. Regardless, the orcs of today exist as weaker, diluted strains of their ancestors, descendants of the fierce boar. The members of the Thousand Maw are Neolithic throwbacks to their porcine ancestors, breeding in isolation for millennia and thus their blood runs closer to boars than modern-day orcs. "

16 pages contain 4 new orc variants, 1 new template, 2 creatures, potions, poisons, armor and more!

224077.name: S.W.E.A.T.
224077.description:
From the introduction:

The set up and play of this game is incredibly simple. Although somewhat abstract, it’s like the Picasso of RPGs. Take your index card and write SWEAT in a descending column; these represent your character's basic stats...


S - Speed
W - Wisdom
E - Everything Else
A - Aspect
T - Toughness

224078.name: Mythic Options:  Mythic Dragonrider Class Options
224078.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Being mythic is awesome!

The rules from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Mythic Adventures provide many options for upgrading a character to the realm of mythic heroes. However, while there are numerous mythic spells and a long list of mythic feats (and even more are available in Mythic Options: The Missing Core Feats, which gives a mythic version of every feat from the core rules that does not already have one), none of these options are specifically designed to work with the dragonrider class (from The Genius Guide to the Dragonrider).

There are champion and guardian path abilities that tie into some dragornider character concepts, but nothing that can add a mythic touch to the dragonrider’s core class features, or to a dragon steed.

Mythic Options: Mythic Dragonrider Class Features offers mythic upgrades for every dragonrider class feature and talent from the core rulebook. It allows dragonrider characters to focus their mythic power entirely on their unique class features, or select just a few such abilities to upgrade while adding the while adding the normal options of mythic feats and path abilities.

224079.name: Sailing Toward Osiris
224079.description:
Pharaoh is dead and his funerary barge sails slowly down the Nile toward his tomb where his spirit will stand before the judgement of Osiris.

Pharaoh had no offspring so tradition holds that the governors of the land be tasked with building monuments to Pharaoh’s glory so that Osiris will favor his spirit in the afterlife. Accordingly, Pharaoh’s successor will be the governor who builds the greatest tribute to the late king.

Resources and laborers are limited, the gods are capricious, and time is short; the memorials must be finished before the barge reaches the temple of Osiris at Men-nefer.




Sailing Toward Osiris is a euro-style game with worker placement, resources management, project completion, and no direct conflict. Down-time is kept to a minimum via a single action, round-and-round turn structure that emphasizes timing decisions and subtle strategies.

The game takes place over four "seasons" with the movement of Pharaoh's barge tracking the game's progress. Each season, after players draw workers from a communal bag, play begins with each player taking a series of one-action turns from a list of 10 possible actions:

1. Play a worker to harvest resources
2. Play a worker to a city for cards
3. Play a worker to a caravan as leader or follower
4. Hire an extra worker
5. Trade at the market
6. Plan a monument
7. Build a monument
8. Play a city card
9. Play a boon card
10. Withdraw from further actions.

Players are working to build sphinxes, obelisks, and pylons to the glory of the late Pharaoh and to earn extra glory by building the monuments on certain river segments and in certain configurations. However, as more monuments are built, resource harvesting becomes less productive and viable locations for future monuments become scarce. By the last season, players will have to be creative to find enough resources or available land on which to build.

The player who has amassed the most glory points by the end of the game will be crowned the new Pharaoh.




Sailing Toward Osiris was inspired by the real events surrounding the death of Rameses XI at the end of Egypt's 20th Dynasty and the ascension of Smendes, a powerful governor in Lower Egypt.

224080.name: MetaRPG - Video Games
224080.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A tabletop role-playing game that allows your group to jump across video game genres to save the world. Designed to be quick to pick up and learn, fast and fun to play.

Players can pick from classes such as the Old School Shooter, the Platformer, the Football Sports Star, the Mascot Fighter, the RTS strategy general and more!

Over 100 items that can be looted! Such as the High Energy Laser Pointer, the Wormhole Gun, the Elemental Creature Ball, the all powerful Apply Real World Physics spell and many more.

Fight over 10 levels, including the Fighter Tournament, Zombie Survival, Kart Racing and MOBA. Can be played in a single session or expended to a multi-session story.

It comes with 10 digital maps, the tiles used to create the maps so you can create your own or the rules can easily be applied to your own favourite game levels.

User summary:

The game is distributed as three separate files:


55-page PDF rules document
ZIP archive containing 10 PNG "map tile" images
ZIP archive containing 76 PNG "game tile" images

224081.name: Jaque Quince
224081.description:
Jaque Quince: Simple rules and short strategic duels inspired by Bauhaus

The objective of the game is to play in such a way that your opponent cannot respond to the opening play.
Jaque Quince has 3 different suits. Each suit has a reference value with respect to the other suits (i.e., every suit is bigger than another suit). Each suit has 5 cards, and the bigger number cards have greater value. Aces are higher than 3, 4, and 5, but they are lower than 2. As there are 3 suits each with 5 cards, there are a total of 15 cards.

Each player start's each hand of the match with 7 cards. The remaining card remains hidden to both players. One player opens a round with a card which must be responded to by a card with the same suit. If suit respond cannot be made, then must be responded by the same number. The player which played the greater value card opens next round. If responding player does not have either same suit or number then the opening player is granted points according to how long the hand was (i.e. the number of the round played).

Jaque Quince was part of the 3rd Annual 18 Card Microgame Contest in 2016 and is planned to be published in some microgames compilations during 2017.

224082.name: Cuál?
224082.description:
From the box:

Cuál? Is an intriguing boardgame of observation and deceiving.
Will you be able to reach victory with your secret piece before your opponent finds it? Which one would be the secret piece of your opponent?

Overview:
Cuál? (translated as “Which one?”) is an abstract strategy game for 2 players in which each one controls 8 pieces in 4 different shapes each shape having unique movement patterns. At the beginning of the match each player choses 1 of their 8 pieces as the secret piece using a deck of 8 cards. Winning may be achieved by reaching the adversary end of the board or by discovering which one is the opponent secret piece.
During the game pieces may be captured but they don’t leave the game, instead they are positioned by whom captured it. By revealing one of the remaining 7 cards, any player may move 2 pieces or 1 piece 2 times in their turn.

224083.name: Trono Oscuro
224083.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

224084.name: 8-Bit Armies - Guardians Campaign
224084.description:
User Summary

Expansion for 8-Bit armies adding a new campaign and the new Guardians faction.

224085.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): The Early Bird Special Play Promo Card
224085.description: Pre-order copies of Blood Bowl (2016 edition) ordered directly from Games Workshop received a copy of a web exclusive promo card while supplies lasted. 'The Early Bird' is a Special Play card which grants a player Pro skill for the first half of the match and a chance to be KO'd in the 2nd half.

224086.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Go Full Beard Special Play Promo Card
224086.description:
Event Promo - Warhammer World Exclusive

The Go Full Beard promo is a special play card for Blood Bowl given out at the Bugman’s Full Beard Cup tournament held at Warhammer World in Nottingham, England on November 26th and 27th, 2016. The card's effect allows a player to beef up their players with bonus skills for one drive before passing out.

224087.name: Pawn Stop
224087.description:
#2 in the 'Take away and play' series of 4Dekx Games.

Pawn Stop is an abstract game for 2 players where you both control the same pawn. Use the pawn to move around the board and collect discs. The first player to collect 3 discs of the same color wins the game.

The board consists of a 5x5 tile grid allowing for variable board lay-outs. The game can be made more difficult by setting the goal to collecting two (or even three) sets of 3 discs.

224088.name: Try-Angle
224088.description:
#3 in the 'Take away and play' series of 4Dekx Games

Try-Angle is a fast-paced strategical game for 2 or 3 players. In the game you try to create a large triangle consisting of 4 smaller triangles in your own color.

Because the game makes use of height as a 4th dimension in addition to the 3 natural ones provided by the triangular shape of the tiles themselves, this proves to be a harder challenge than the mere description would suggest.

224089.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Team Titans Special Play Card Pack
224089.description:
Description from the publisher:

A ton of weird, wonderful and bizarre events can and will happen on and off the pitch during games of Blood Bowl. The best way to represent these happenings is with Special Play cards, and this set of 26 Team Titans cards, usable by any and all teams adds a whole load of extra anarchy.

They’re split into two decks – the Benefits of Training and the Dirty Tricks decks – each featuring a wide variety of extra rules that make your games of Blood Bowl that little bit more unpredictable. You don’t have to use them, but you’re missing out if not!

224090.name: Hostile Takeover
224090.description:
#1 in the 'Play and take away' series of 4Dekx Games

Hostile Takeover is a strategic game for 2 persons. You are a shareholder of a company and you can move executives, managers and workers. The aim of the game is to make the workers of your opponent yours.

The game is played on a 7x7 tile grid. Each player begins with 11 workers (large sized disks), 7 managers (medium sized disks) and 4 executives (small sized disks). Pieces can move independently but managers must always be place on top of a worker and executives must always be placed on top of a manager.

The color of the disk a the top determines which player owns the piece; the size of the lowest disk moved, determines the possible move. Workers move 1 space orthogonally, managers move 1 space diagonally and executives can move 1 space in any direction.

The first player to control 6 of the opponents workers, while still controlling six of his own, controls more than half of the workers on the board and has pulled off a 'hostile takeover'.

The game comes with some extra and/or specially marked components allowing for more different games to be played with the same set.

224093.name: Moonshine Shutdown
224093.description:
Illegal winemaking is, in whatever age, the best way to make a fortune in the black market. It is also a crime that the police force is eager to solve.

Now within a closed area, there's secret winemaking activity going on. Meanwhile, the police has found out about the activity and is waiting for the winemakers' arrest. Can the winemakers get away with it? Can they make a big fortune out of it eventually?
In Moonshine Shutdown, players play the winemakers who try to brew as much wine as possible before the police lock down the area. Whoever makes the most wine earns the most points and wins the game.

224094.name: Spillet om Bamsens Fødselsdag
224094.description:
The players travel around the board revealing hidden animals and then matching them up with the birthday cards on the side. The player with the most collected cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Bamsemor has made birthday cards for Bamsens birthday. All the animals of Hakkebakkeskongen are invited, and you must help Bamsemor to find them.

You'll need to check behind every blueberry bush, and remember where each animal is hidden when you find them.

It's not easy as they keep disapearing back into the forest. Once you find an animal and have the birthday card that matches you can place the card out infront of you.

The player with the most birthday cards at the end of the game wins, and gets to go to the party.


Bamsemor har laget fødselsdagsskort til Bamsens fødselsdag. Alle dyrene i Hakkebakkeskogen er invitert, og du må hjelpre Bamsemor med å finne dem.

Du må lete bak hver en blårbærbusk, og huske hvor dyrene skjuler seg når du finner dem.

Det er ikke alltid så lett, forstadig vekk forsvinner de i skogen. Finner du et dyr og har fødselsdagsskortet som hører til, får du straks legge kortet foran deg.

Spilleren som har flest fødslsdagskort til slut, vinner spillet og får være med på festen.

224095.name: LEGO Dimensions 2: The Second Mashup
224095.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




User Summary
LEGO Dimensions 2: The Second Mashup is a Lego-themed action-adventure. Characters from iconic entertainment franchises join forces and battle in worlds outside of their own.

224096.name: Warlock
224096.description:
From publisher blurb:

The warlock has made a pact with a powerful extraplanar being, gaining magical powers and spellcasting ability.

This is a conversion of the 5th Edition warlock to OSR systems, most notably first advanced edition, but also the original rules and and the basic/expert (B/X) sets.

(Previously I had created a class named the warlock, but based on a third party intrepreation of the third edition class and is quite different than this, as the 5th edition rules did not yet have an SRD and that warlock was not open content. I tried to stick as close to the 5th edition class as possible, making some minor changes to fit the older system better based on playtesting, as well as filling in gaps because the SRD5 is kind of sketchy. For instance, I added several new patrons to its one, and a handful of new invocations that suggested themselves in play.)

224097.name: Venommancer Hybrid Class
224097.description:
From publisher blurb:

A tiny poke can grow and fester into the most dangerous of infections. The venommancer knows this to be true. She relies on it. The venommancer can control even the most viral contagions with her mind. With a flick of her wrist a disease will take off, and with a sneer, it collapses in on itself. she gives herself up to her weapons of choice. With each passing day, she becomes more of a walking petri dish of destruction. It takes self-control to contain such weapons of mass infection. It takes adventure to find a use for them.

a complete 1-20 hybrid class based on the alchemist and kineticist.
New Feats.
New Weapon Qualities
And more!

224098.name: The Northern Realm
224098.description:
From the introduction:

The Northern Realm is a role-playing game set in a medieval world of fable. It draws from history and myth, providing a setting equal parts familiar and surreal. The Northern Realm affords many tools for the storytelling experience, which you can participate in as the player or the story master. Within this book there are many story hooks and mysteries, including the first chapter of a campaign at the end. There are also folktales, artifacts, ruins, magical creatures, gods, and, of course, heroes that can spin many stories unto themselves.

The continent of Rhen dominates the setting. Within it players can explore. It is a rich universe that can influence you, as much as you can it. Every game has players and a Story Master (SM). The Story Master is equal parts author, narrator, and god. The SM designs the story based on elements in this book and then describes events as they happen in the game world, playing the characters within and deciding how the players’ decisions affect the world. The players in turn, explore the setting the SM has created, taking turns interacting with their environment and describing what they do.

The Northern Realm is intended to be a shared story as much as a multiplayer game. Control of what happens around you by way of environmental effects, non-playable characters (NPCs), and events lands squarely in the hands of the SM, but how you influence the events around you is bounded only by your imagination. It is the SM’s job to choose a place within The Northern Realm and use the information available to him/her to build a rich environment. We have provided a plethora of resources in this book to make sure that detailed descriptions of histories, geography, cultures, magic, monsters, organizations, even fables are available for use.

224099.name: The Domesday Book (Volume 4, Issue 7 - Dec 2016)
rpgissuearticle: A General Necrology of the Undead
Magic Items for the Practical Joker, Part IV in a Trilogy
Part I: The Panoply of the Lord of Almansa and Defender of Mancha and Alcarria
Shrine to Saint Isabella the Calm
Unique, but not too Powerful, Part I of III: Weapons
224099.description:
from the website

Treebore and Captain_K are pleased to reconstitute The Domesday Book fanzine for your reading pleasure and gaming use. Issue VII starts a bit on the dark and deathly side, but is quickly turned. A necrology leads right into new undead, spells, and magic items. Hiding from the light are two fighter variants and one of three ancient mounts rediscovered from the Lost Bestiaries of Atlantis. The material then turns straight to four adventures of varied length and plot. The contributors filled even more pages with new magic items of wondrous history and power to the truly cheesy and five pre-generated characters to use them. Finally, Ancient Engines & Alchemy, technology for Castles & Crusades, characters, and castle keepers closes out the issue. A big Christmas "Trollzah!" to all the contributing authors & artists.

224100.name: The Northern Realm in a Nutshell
224100.description:
From the introduction:

The Northern Realm is a large piece of work, but is based upon a few conceptual and narrative ideas. A modified version of the d20 rules works to accomplish those goals within the game. While the main work has been designed and organized to facilitate easy reference, this document hopes to provide a quick rundown of the game’s setting, rules, and play philosophy in order to aid players and story masters in participating in and designing adventures in the Northern Realm.

User summary:

This concise introduction to the basic concepts of the setting is presented in broad outline. Usually, it is distributed as a separate document with the core book.

224101.name: Map of Rhen
224101.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a full-size map of Rhen.

The Map dimensions are 25 inches by 35 inches.

User summary:

The continent of Rhen is the principle adventure locale in the game. The JPG file measures an amazing 10,393 x 7,500 pixels (with all the fine detail that suggests).

224102.name: Just a Game - Playtest Packet 2
224102.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're logging up on the computer, happily cracking open the brand new shiny MMO you just downloading from the company site, ready to make your character and start on a new set of adventures. But something changes when you click "start playing"....because instead of watching a load screen boot up, you find the world turning black and when you wake up it seems like you've become your character and the world around you is... is the tutorial mission. What is going on here?

User summary:

The second iteration of the game supports only Powered by the Apocalypse mechanics. It is distributed as a ZIP archive containing eight PDF files (one of which, noted here, combines the other seven separate files and a blank character sheet).

224103.name: Los Muchos Rostros de Kishar
224103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Los Muchos Rostros de Kishar es un suplemento gratuito para La Puerta de Ishtar que incluye 74 personajes listos para usar, como PNJs o incluso como Personajes Jugadores. Podrás encontrar Awilu, Mushkenu, Wardu, Uridimmu e incluso Fenicios entre sus páginas. Si necesitas un antagonista y buscas inspiración, o precisas de un secundario rápidamente y no tienes tiempo o la inclinación de crearlo ex-profeso, aquí tienes una gran cantidad de personalidades de todos los tiempos. Seguro que encontrarás lo que necesitas.

Cada uno de estos personajes ha sido creado por uno de los mecenas que participó en el crowdfunding de La Puerta de Ishtar, y ha sido corregido y adaptado para que encaje perfectamente en el entorno de juego, incluyendo los perfiles y estádisticas para el combate.

¡Los Muchos Rostros de Kishar ofrece nuevas y sorprendentes perspectivas de la tierra entre los ríos y el Imperio de Akkad!


Translation courtesy of Google:

The Many Faces of Kishar is a free supplement for the Ishtar Gate that includes 74 ready-to-use characters, such as NPCs or even as Player Characters. You will find Awilu, Mushkenu, Wardu, Uridimmu and even Phoenician among its pages. If you need an antagonist and are looking for inspiration, or need a secondary quickly and do not have the time or the inclination to create it ex-professo , here you have a lot of personalities of all time. Surely you will find what you need.

Each of these characters has been created by one of the patrons who participated in the crowdfunding of the Gate of Ishtar, and has been corrected and adapted to fit perfectly in the game environment, including profiles and statistics for combat.

The Many Faces of Kishar offers amazing new perspectives of the land between the rivers and the Akkad Empire!

224104.name: Lo Que los Brujos Anhelan
224104.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enmeduranki, el Rey Brujo de Sippar y autoproclamado segundo mayor alquimista vivo, ha ido demasiado lejos en sus experimentos; ha probado la droga de los Middu, ha contemplado los secretos del pasado y ahora le persigue un Lunkalbu, uno de los horribles Sabuesos Insaciables de más allá del tiempo. Se ha encerrado en sus aposentos y ha mandado eliminar cualquier ángulo que hubiera en ellos, mientras espera que sus siervos le saquen del atolladero.

Su única oportunidad de salvación es un poderoso conjuro, que se rumorea puede controlar a estos seres. El problema es que dicho conjuro se encuentra tras los muros de la Gran Biblioteca, un lugar maldito y plagado de horrores que, además, se encuentra en mitad de la Ciudad Muerta de Sippar-Amnanum, totalmente abandonada desde hace mucho por una plaga fallida obra del propio Rey Brujo.

Dos (¿o quizá tres?) poderosos brujos planean internarse en ella con el objeto de encontrar el conjuro, aunque sus planes no son precisamente ayudar al Rey Brujo...

En este módulo encontrarás una descripción completa de la Gran Biblioteca, así como de las criaturas que la habitan y los poderosos conjuros y objetos de poder que se encuentran en su interior. Los personajes podrán explorarla por iniciativa propia o servir a uno de los ambiciosos patrones que anhelan hacerse con el conjuro: Irka-Aru, la hermana del Rey Brujo y comandante de los Hasharu, o Nettu-Imash, un antiguo noble despechado y con ansias de venganza.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Enmeduranki, the Sorcerer King of Sippar and self-proclaimed second greatest living alchemist, has gone too far in his experiments; Has tried the drug of the Middu, has contemplated the secrets of the past and is now pursued by a Lunkalbu, one of the horrible Insatiable Hounds from beyond time. He has shut himself up in his quarters and has ordered to eliminate any angle in them, while waiting for his servants to get him out of the quagmire.

His only chance for salvation is a powerful spell, which is rumored to be able to control these beings. The problem is that this spell is found behind the walls of the Great Library, a cursed and horrible place that is also in the middle of the Dead City of Sippar-Amnanum, totally abandoned for long ago by a failed plague work Of the Witch King himself.

Two (or perhaps three?) Powerful wizards plan to go into it in order to find the spell, although their plans are not precisely to help the Witch King ...

In this module you will find a complete description of the Great Library, as well as of the creatures that inhabit it and the powerful incantations and objects of power that are in its interior. The characters will be able to explore it on their own initiative or serve one of the ambitious bosses who long for the spell: Irka-Aru, the sister of the Witch-king and commander of the Hasharu, or Nettu-Imash, a formerly despised and anxious revenge.

224105.name: Starguard Threat Report
224105.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need adversaries for you Star Hero campaign. Here you will find 4 new groups to add to your campaign. The Tsu’arn, a shapeshifting race that specialize in assassinations. The Technomages, individuals that use technology to simulate magic. The Xenoloids, an insect race that devour whole planets and everything on them.

Some of this material was originally presented in Tome of Villainy as well as Technomacy. The material has been modified and in some cases expanded for this material.

224106.name: The Ruins Sea
rpg: Planet Archipelago: A Medieval Science Fiction Role-Play Game
224106.description:
From publisher blurb:

A great adventure of under sea exploration. Player characters will need swimming and diving skills to hunt for sunken treasure or to due combat underwater while holding their breath.

224107.name: P.Y.G.: Pretty Young Girl
224107.description: P.Y.G. or Pretty Young Girl is a card hand management game of romantic affection theme. In this game, he who has the closest numbered card to the open goal card (pretty young girl's heart) number at the end of each round wins that round and takes 2~3 points according to the position.
