After several rounds the game ends when there is less than 2 untaken points and the player with most point wins the game.

224108.description:
Magus: Aura Mortis is a re-implementation of Magus: Fortuna et nostis. In Magus, the players embody powerful sorcerers who send heroes under their control to plunder the castle of Ardeth, their mentor, as they crave the treasures and secrets that are hidden there.
In a game the players must fulfill missions and different objectives until obtaining 10 dominion points and thus to proclaim the new lord of the castle. In addition to controlling a hero, the player has spells at his disposal with which he can alter the very structure of the castle.
In a Magus turn, a player can perform up to 2 normal actions (move, attack, play spells, among others) and any number of quick actions (use knowledge, advance missions, use relics, etc.) Each action has a cost that must be paid whit energy from one of the two existing wells: Well of power (Green) and Well of control (purple). As the game progresses players will gain energy that they can freely assign to their power or control reserve as needed for one or the other action.
The Magus main mode of play is competitive, each player will try to reach before the rest to the 10 dominion points using his hero and his spells to delay the advance of his enemies. But there is also the cooperative mode, here players must defeat the powerful archmage Ardeth. For this they must travel the castle fulfilling different objectives that reduce the dominion of the archmage before this one arrives at the castle for the final combat.
In cooperative mode, Dominion points are a measure to Ardeth's strength, and players must reduce it as much as possible as they prepare for their arrival. When the archmage appears in the castle they must face it, and the life of Ardeth will be determined by the dominion accumulated at the moment of its appearance.


Magus: Aura Mortis es una reimplementación de Magus: "Fortuna et nostis". En Magus los jugadores encarnan a poderosos hechiceros que envían a héroes bajo su control a saquear el castillo de Ardeth, su mentor, ya que ansían los tesoros y secretos que allí se esconden.
En una partida los jugadores deberán cumplir misiones y distintos objetivos hasta conseguir 10 puntos de dominio y así proclamarse el nuevo señor del castillo. Ademas de controlar a un héroe, el jugador tiene conjuros a su disposición con los que podrá alterar la estructura misma del castillo.
En un turno de Magus un jugador puede realizar hasta 2 acciones normales (mover, atacar, jugar conjuros, entre otras) y cualquier cantidad de acciones rápidas (usar saberes, avanzar misiones, usar reliquias, entre otras. Cada acción tiene un costo que debe ser pagado siempre fichas de energía de alguno de los dos tipos existentes. Existe la energía de poder (de color verde) y la energía de control (de color violeta. A medida que avanza la partida los jugadores irán ganando energía que podrán asignar libremente a su reserva de poder o de control según la necesitar para una u otra acción.
El modo principal de juego de Magus es competitivo, cada jugador intentará llegar antes que el resto a los 10 puntos de dominio valiéndose de su héroe y sus conjuros para retrasar el avance de sus enemigos. Pero también existe el modo cooperativo, aquí los jugadores deben derrotar al poderoso archimago Ardeth. Para ello deben recorrer el castillo cumpliendo distintos objetivos que reduzcan el dominio del archimago antes de que este llegue al castillo para el combate final.
En el modo cooperativo los puntos de dominio miden la fuerza de Ardeth, y los jugadores deben reducirlo lo mas posible mientras se preparan para su llegada. Cuando el archimago aparece en el castillo deben enfrentarlo, y la vida de Ardeth estará determinada por la dominio acumulado al momento de su aparición.
224108.name: Magus: Aura Mortis

224109.name: Astounding Interplanetary Adventures
224109.description:
Minimalist pulp sci-fi roleplaying

From the introduction:

Astounding Interplanetary Adventures is a minimalist pulp sci-fi roleplaying game in the vein of Flash Gordon and Buck Rogers, for 3+ players.

224110.name: Clown Helsing (Revised)
224110.description:
From the introduction:

Clowns. We've all seen them... riding their unicycles, blowing up balloons at kid's parties, piling in garish hordes from tiny cars, waddling around in bulbous red shoes, passed out in a dumpster stinking of booze and regret. For what do these martyrs of mirth sacrifice themselves? The answer is they do it for us. Not just to fill our need for laughter and merriment, but because they defy the doom of mankind! Clowns are man's only salvation against... Vampires.

You've seen Vampires too; you just didn't know it. Maybe they were killing the mood at a party, ruining a great punchline, layering red tape onto a business, or just plain old-fashioned sucking the blood from the living. Contrary to myth they do much of this in broad daylight, their only fear of the sun being that it might expose them to mockery. They drain humor from the world because they fear someone might dare to laugh at them. You know the type.

Vampires are right to be afraid, as their immortality depends on their dignity. Clowns must destroy a Vampire in a hilarious way for it to stick. This war has gone on for ages, and unfortunately the old “Gags” like garlic and crosses barely get a chuckle nowadays. Sure, folks thought being impaled on a stake with a brick in your mouth was the acme of comedy once, but today's Clown plays for a tough crowd. Fortunately, Vampires fall into the “Straight man” role so eagerly that it isn't impossible to set up a killer Gag.

...and do it you must, or the world will be drained of everything that makes it worth living. Ridding the world of life-sucking undead is your sacred duty as a member of Clown Helsing!

224111.name: Draconic Happiness Factory
224111.description:
From the introduction:

Driven by magical insanity, funded by hoarded treasure, inspired to reward the good girls and boys.

A Christmas-themed tale for 4-5 adventurers of 6th or 7th level.

224113.name: The CORE Codex
224113.description:
From the introduction:

The Core Codex contains a set of rules and guidelines called the Character Oriented Role-playing Engine (C.O.R.E). The bulk of the rules have been curated from almost twenty years of role-playing experience and built around a d20 System base. Over the last few years these rules have been modified, prodded, twisted, kept in a vat for genetic experimentation and finally boiled in a magical cauldron to be delivered to you the reader. The Core rules is an “engine” intended to power any kind of role-playing game (‘RPG’). While the system is written as a balanced set of rules, they should be viewed more as a set of building blocks and guidelines allowing players to create their own role-playing games.

224114.name: The Last Patient
224114.description:
User Summary

"Last patient" is a short first-person horror shooter with a frightening atmosphere.

224115.name: Still in Business
224115.description:
Theme:
A light card game for 2-6 players about being moonshine bootleggers in the hills of Louisiana, at the height of Prohibition! You'll be establishing your stills, paddocks and businesses, making, moving and selling moonshine, hiring Bootleggers to defend your turf, raiding other player's properties for their goods and trying to keep one step ahead of the Feds. You'll make fast friends to take down stronger players, but beware... those allies you have just made will always have schemes and machinations of their own.

Game-Play:
Turns go quickly around the table, with each player able to take one action.
Players can choose to build paddocks, stills and businesses (placing these cards in their "Property" playspace), roll a dice to make or sell moonshine (Results of 1 mean a still blows up, or the Feds appear!), steal any building from another player's Property, hire bootleggers to defend their own Property, or even Tip Off the Feds to disrupt a rival's moonshine operation.

Creating an efficient production line for your moonshine operation, defending your property, temporarily allying with other players to cut another rival down to size, and choosing the right moment to sell or strike are keys to success in Still in Business.

Goal:
The ultimate goal is to sell 5 moonshine. Whether you make this yourself, or steal from other players before sale, is entirely up to you and your real-life sense of morality (or lack thereof!)

224117.name: Um el Tuweisat
224117.description:
Also known as "The Little Goat Game".

This is considered the children's version of Um El Bagara, and it originated in Africa, in the area now known as the Sudan.

The board is a 2x3 mancala board, and 3 stones are placed in each of the six playing wells. Players take turns moving stones by picking up all the stones in a well then dropping a stone in each well until they run out, moving either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the position of the well. A well with only a single stone cannot be moved.

After your move, starting with the well you last placed a stone into, any wells that have exactly two stones may be placed in your scoring well. If there is a well that you cannot score (it has a number of stone other than two and cannot be your well), then any that come after it in sequence may not be scored either.

The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. Any stones left on a players side of the board are added to those in his scoring well. Whoever has the most stones is the winner.

224119.name: 21 Days
224119.description:
21 Days is a dice driven 1 or 2 player survival boardgame.

17 October 1903.
The Esperanza ends up in a terrible storm and loses its battle against the elements. 163 people lose their lives, but a small group survives this disaster and washes ashore on the isle Juan Ansidad. For weeks they wait, hoping to be rescued, but they slowly run out of food. They come to realise; if they ever want to get home again, they will have to take matters into their own hands again. A raft is carefully put together and with a small ration four brave survivors try their luck on the Pacific, looking for salvation.
You have found the logbook in which the four survivors wrote down their adventures; their story, which lasted 21 days.

In 21 Days you relive the events recorded in the found logbook, over a period of 21 days. The purpose of the game is to have (at least) one of the survivors rescued by the rescueship on the 21st day.
You do this by following the events described in the logbook and having the survivors, represented by two stacked dice per survivor, choose and perform actions on the various locations on the gameboard, by using their placement dice.

Don't lose too many planks of the raft, for you will lose some of your survivors as well! In 21 Days the four survivors are stuck together on a raft made out of 6 planks, held loosely together. Some events during the 21 days may cause some planks to drift off. There are ways to prevent this, like saving up hope tokens or picking the right bottlecards.
When the rescueship enters the final spot on the rescuetrack and there are still survivors left on the raft, you will be saved and win the game.

224120.name: GINGA
224120.description:
This is space card game.
Player is God.
Gods fight with strength of star as card.
In this game, God can rob and break down other God's star for advantage.
God with stronger star will win at the end of game.

224121.name: Strandead
224121.description:
It’s been 14 long years since the virus took over. You and your only friend are stranded on an island, overrun by zombies. Avoid zombie attacks, backstab other survivors and fight to be the last remaining survivors!

Each player receives seven cards from the Prime deck and two survivors with ten health each. Each round, a player can discard a Set (1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 6 of a Kind), a Run (3-7 consecutive cards), or Scavenge cards and finish their turn with 7 cards in hand. The next player in turn must respond to the play by matching or raising the Set or Run to avoid a zombie attack (indicated by the amount of zombies visible on the table). If Scavenge cards have been discarded, the players must respond accordingly. When a survivor is killed, they turn into zombies, increasing the amount of zombies in an attack. The game is over when there is only one player with survivors.

In essence, Strandead is a trick-taking card game. Players must choose their plays carefully, in order to survive the next attack and backstab other players in turn. Every survivor has a unique ability that can shift the game in their favour. An ever-growing number of Zombies continue to make the attacks more vicious as the game progresses, leading to a fast paced, hectic and unique experience.

Strandead is designed for 2-4 players, with an average playtime of 20 mins.

224122.name: AVES
boardgamepublisher: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)
224122.description: AVES is a fast-paced set collection game. In this game, players become birds with exquisite tastes who strategically utilize fruit-trading rules to collect fruits that transfer the color of their plumage. Now, fight for beauty and become the brightest rainbow bird!

224123.name: Animania
boardgamepublisher: Play With Us Design (玩聚設計)
224123.description: The animals are ready to fight for the throne of the zoo! Select an animal you wish to help in Animania, then make it attack, defend it with your shield, or have it take a precious potion so that it can defeat tons of opponents and become the mighty King of the zoo! Be careful, though, because if it kills any opponent accidentally, it will be despised by other animals and disqualified for the throne!

224125.name: Tesla vs. Edison: Duel
224125.description:
A 15-30 minute 2 player card game that brings the War of Currents to light in an easy-to-learn, fast-playing, but seriously strategic game. Players take control of Nikola Tesla or Thomas Edison and build a company that claims projects in regions around the United States, advance the latest technologies, engage in a propaganda war around AC and DC technologies, and buy stock shares in smaller electricity companies. During the game players bring famous luminaries of the time into their company that each offer unique actions and abilities. The winner is the company that wins two of the three main systems - controlling regions with projects, being ahead in the PR race, and holding the most valuable stock portfolio. Tesla and Edison each have a special auto-win condition that players can trigger during the game to win right away.

While Tesla vs. Edison: Duel has all of the aspects introduced in our hit big box offering Tesla vs. Edison, it is designed for light-to-medium weight gamers to enjoy. Fans of the current game will love how this fits into a super fast play window that is easy-to-play. And, people who found the 90-120 minutes and larger component presence of the original game will enjoy being transported into the roaring 1880's and experience what the War of Currents was all about in an easy-to-play way!

224126.name: FIRED
224126.description:
Description from the publisher:

Yours and three other offices has been acquired in a hostile take over, your new parent company only has the intention of keeping the employees of the best office! Your job is to make sure your office survives the merger!

FIRED is a quick 2-4 player card game where players compete to fire their opponent’s boss. Each employee in your hand has a different ability that will help you fire employees from the other offices, zero in on their boss and fire them!

From the Axe Man to the Fall Guy, you can work to ensure that your office makes it. Be the Hero, Save the Day and Get Someone FIRED!

224127.name: Solar Fade
224127.description:
Cover Blurb -

Solar Fade is a Cepheus Engine (or other Classic 2D6 SF rules-set) one-shot scenario for 1-5 players. Designed to be played in a single session, the PCs find themselves part of a desperate scientific mission to discover why the sun is fading.

The world of Neoltillis is dying. The native species are dying off in droves as the sun fades, in six months the millions of human inhabitants will be dying too. In a desperate move the government fits out a ship to dive through the suns lethal corona to gather vital data, on which lies the hope of an entire planet.

As the PCs pilot this ship on its mission, they discover the alien device responsible for the solar fade. This leads them to an alien invading force that only they can stop.

224128.name: Highest Bidder: Art Auction
224128.description:
In Highest Bidder: Art Auction players are faced with three paintings each round and bid on them using cards from their hands. Decide on the order in which you want to play your cards, then at the count of three all players place their bids simultaneously; you don't know how many cards each player will bid, nor what might lurk inside the bids. Cards are then revealed one at a time.

Cash cards - starting at $10,000 and going as high as $70,000 - are mixed with strategic effect cards and this is where the game becomes truly exciting! When an effect card is revealed it takes effect immediately. Effects include "Draw a random card", "Shuffle the bid pile of an opponent", "Next card is invalid", "Swap a card with an opponent", and more. Laugh-out-loud moments often occur as bids don't play out as planned and unforeseen circumstances appear. Your effect cards can even end up hurting yourself.

"Highest Bidder: Art Auction" is based on the original game "Highest Bidder". With brand new and highly detailed artwork, larger cards of better quality, 16 brand new "advanced cards" not seen in the original game, and an "advanced play" rule book on top of the base game, the "Highest Bidder: Art Auction" box is packed with goodies and hours of fun!

224129.name: Triangles: Original
224129.description:
Description from the publisher:

Triangles is a series of 90-card decks of playing cards. Each card represents a piece of a triangle, numbered 1-3. The triangles are "cut" in one of three ways (horizontal, vertical and centered cut) which works as suits, and the numbers 1, 2 and 3 of the same cut make a complete triangle.

There are 81 triangle pieces and 9 whole triangles (jokers) in each deck.

Each installment in the Triangles series has a distinct visual theme and rules for two games: a base game titled "Triangle Mayhem" and a bonus game only introduced in that particular installment, however any Triangles game can be played with any of the decks.

The bonus game in "Triangles: Original is titled "Triangle Tricks", and the deck features photographic artwork from the world cities of Sydney, Los Angeles and London.

TRIANGLE MAYHEM: Complete triangles by playing cards (triangle pieces) at the center of the table. The table is free for all meaning anyone can start a new triangle, continue an existing triangle, or complete a triangle by playing the final missing piece. Multiple triangles can be in the making simultaneously and whoever completes a triangle scores its cards.

TRIANGLE TRICKS: A trick-taking game with a twist where the highest number (1-3, joker) takes the trick. In the event that two players are tied the same trick continues and all players - even those who played a low card - are still in the game. Points can can quickly stack up and experienced players will know when to play low cards, trusting that other players will tie to keep the trick going for another round.

224130.name: The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185
224130.description:
The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185 is a 2 player wargame set in 12th century Japan. The Imperial court has come under the influence of the powerful Taira clan. The Minamoto clan, enemies of the Taira, start a revolt that will eventually annihilate the Tairas and found the first Shogunate in Japanese history.

Players control one of the two rival clans, moving their armies (composed of novice and samurai cavalry and infantry, as well as leaders) and fighting battles. A common deck is used that contains events, combat and action cards and Bakufu cards. Bakufu cards are small objectives that allow for a political victory.

The Genpei War: Taira vs Minamoto 1180-1185 is a freely downloadable Print-and-Play game!

224132.name: Monopoly: Ghostbusters edition
224132.description: There's something strange in your neighborhood! save the world from paranormal activity by subduing the vapors, entities and slimers at famous new York locations from the original Ghostbusters movie. Improve your locations with custom sculpted Ghost traps and storage units to hold the spooks at bay. No job is too big, no fee is too big in this custom edition of Monopoly! ages 8+ players 2-6.

224133.name: The Cousins' War
224133.description:
The Wars of the Roses were fought between the Houses of York and Lancaster for over three decades during the 15th century in England. The houses were both branches of the royal family, therefore the Wars were originally known as "The Cousins' War". Each player represents one of the houses as they fight battles and gain influence to control England.

The Cousins' War is played over a maximum of five rounds, with each round representing between five and ten years of the conflict. Each round involves gaining influence across England and preparing for a climactic battle.

In each round, the players decide where the current battlefield will be, playing action cards to deploy troops to the battlefield, while also increasing or decreasing their influence in the regions, after which they fight. Players resolve the battle by engaging in bluff and counter-bluff, using three dice, until only one side has troops remaining on the field. Winning the battle helps to consolidate your house's influence on the board.

You win The Cousins' War either by dominating all the regions of England or by controlling the most regions at the end of the fifth round.

224134.name: Munchkin: Rick and Morty
224134.description: Munchkin: Rick and Morty is a standalone version of Munchkin using the many characters, items and events from the Rick and Morty animated series.

224135.name: Laughcronyms
224135.description: Laughcronyms is a party game of quick, creative thinking and fast, funny sketching. Create hilarious, new meanings for known acronyms and then draw them in a picture.

224136.name: Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Test Drive
224136.description:
User summary:

Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms uses a resolution system called the Synergy Game System. The process uses a pool of d10 (from 1 to 3 dice) against either an opponent's dice pool or a static target number. The dice pool size is determined by a characters Aptitude in a relevant skill. Tasks may have difficulty modifiers. Combat occurs in rounds, each character taking an action in each round. Several special types of actions are possible; generally, however, combat works via combat skills.

The Test Drive document includes basic "quick start" rules, pre-generated characters, and an introductory scenario entitled Wolves and Goblins. The Test Drive does not present complete rules for character creation. The Test Drive document refers to a Kickstarter which did not fund.

This game was intended to be the "second edition of" Synergy Fantasy.

224137.name: Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Players Guide
224137.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book contains all the rules needed for character generation in the Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Roleplaying Game. Races, origins, backgrounds, training packages, a host of skills, lots of equipment and plenty of magic. It's all here between these covers.

Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Players Guide sets the stage for epic adventure in either the world of your choosing or in one of our published settings. All you need to play are your imagination, someone willing to be Moderator, friends to join in, and up to three ten-sided dice each.

This is the second edition of Synergy Fantasy; rebranded as Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms with a host of additional content, rules addition, revisions and expansions. Synergy is the same game system as that found in Blue Planet (2nd Edition) adapted for the fantasy genre.

224138.name: Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Moderators Guide
224138.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This book contains all the rules needed for Moderators in the Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Roleplaying Game. The game rules, how to create new magic, guidelines on moderation, wilderness survival and a small bestiary. Its all here between these covers.

Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms Moderators Guide is the second of the core rulebooks which set the stage for epic adventure in either the world of your choosing or in one of our published settings. All you need to play are your imagination, someone willing to be Moderator, friends to join in, and up to three ten-sided dice each.

This is the second edition of Synergy Fantasy; rebranded as Worlds of Adventure: Fantasy Realms with a host of additional content, rules addition, revisions and expansions. Synergy is the same game system as that found in Blue Planet (2nd Edition) adapted for the fantasy genre.

224139.name: Sigil: The City of Doors
224139.description:
From the introduction:

It’s considered by some to be the jewel of the Outlands, the nexus of power of the multiverse, a place of great beauty or ugliness. Every day in Sigil, deals are made that seal the fate of hundreds and thousands, negotiators barter for peace in the Blood War, and factotums seek the truth to the meaning of everything. People die, ideals are born, and great power is wielded with the flick of a finger.

Sigil is a place of contradictions. It’s the center of an infinite multiverse. It’s an embattled neutral ground in a battlefield of philosophy. It’s the City of Doors and yet it’s called the Cage. It’s home to pit fiends and solars, devas and yugoloths, all living and drinking and socializing in more or less peaceful state.

224140.name: Player's Guide to Planescape
224140.description:
An introduction to the Planescape campaign setting

From the introduction:

Planescape is a campaign setting for the Dungeons & Dragons fantasy role-playing game. As its name suggests, the setting crosses and comprises the numerous planes of existence, encompassing an entire cosmology called the Great Wheel. This includes many of the other Dungeons & Dragons worlds, linking them via inter-dimensional magical portals.

224142.name: Rave in a Cave
224142.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Rave in a Cave! There are many colossal caves across the land with their own secrets. Not all of them contain pirates, twisty little passages all alike and XYZZY, but there will be lots of fun there anyway.

224143.name: Rumble in the Jungle
224143.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Rumble in the Jungle! Jungles hold many secrets deep within them and so that’s why they can be treated as overland “dungeons”. I hope you branch out and decide to explore some.

224144.name: Treemendous Fun
224144.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Treemendous Fun! Forests hold many secrets deep within them and so that’s why they can be treated as overland “dungeons”. I hope you branch out and decide to explore some.

224145.name: Word Crack
224145.description:
User Summary

Make as many words out of a 4x4 grid of letters, but there's a two minute time limit. Challenge your friends and see who can score the most points. Some Scrabble like functionality too, as certain randomly picked letters can score double and triple points.

224146.name: Simply Clever Cards Arithmetic
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
224146.description:
SimplyClever.Cards Arithmetic combine traditional playing cards, math flash cards and the multiplication table from 0 to 12. The deck has 52 cards in 4 colours numbered 0-12, and 4 jokers.

Designed to function like a regular deck of cards, SimplyClever.Cards Arithmetic allows you to play any regular card game you want to - but with a mathematical twist! Game examples: 500, Blackjack, Bridge, Casino, Crazy Eights, Egyptian Ratscrew, Go Fish, Hearts, Memory, Old Maid, Poker, Slap Jack, Snap, UNO, Whist

The key mechanic is that each card lists 5 multiplication products at the bottom, below the main card value (ranging from 0 to 12). Mathematical versions of regular card games are created by combining three cards such that the product of two card values can be found among the 5 listed on a third card.

E.g. if you take one card numbered 11 and one card numbered 12, you need to match these with a third card that has the product 132 at the bottom. These three cards can represent different equations such as multiplication 11x12=132, division 132/12=11 or even fractions 1/12=11/132.

224147.name: Demon Lords of Porphyra
224147.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the depths of the Abyss… The Demon Lords of Porphyra!

“Oh, Demon Lords from the pits, the blasted layers of the Abyss, hear my cry, accept my sacrifice, recognize my obedience and grant me the boon I wish

Ayporos, patron of self-inflicted poison… The Dark Mistress, demon Lord of the sinister city of Shadowlight… Morcheox, demon-asteroid celestial destroyer… Tajam’muhur, balor-Lord of the vandal hordes…and Zaqqit, fallen angel of goddess-arbiter Gerana- these are a few of the Demon Lords that have a foothold in the Patchwork Planet of Pophyra. Rejected in the struggle of the NewGods War, the myriad Demon Lords are lesser in power than the Gods, but have ways of coercing the weak with demonstrations of how Chaos and Evil can give them gain.

Perry Fehr’s Demon Lords of Porphyra from Purple Duck Games contains detailed data on 15 demon lords in statistics of legend, church, and rituals, and demonic boons. Magic items are listed, including the awful Book of the Demon Lords and the Blood-Queen Thurin’Waethil’s Revenge’s Tear artifacts. 14 spells are here, favored by many of the demon lords, that can be used by adventurers, or their enemies. Finally, several new domains and subdomains are writ her for your guarded study, such as Anarchy, Betrayal, and Genocide!

If your interests lean towards the dangerous, chaotic and slightly sinful, get your copy of Demon Lords of Porphyra from the dastardly demonologists at Purple Duck Games today, because, as the forbidden knowledge of Naehemoth the Crawling Evil would tell you, our games are what you want… and tell them Pazuzu sent you!

224148.name: TITechCorp
224148.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D.s is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full time job to try and keep track of them as well as update information about the, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This is a series of small products that will introduce new villains and heroes for you campaign.

This installment will introduce TITechCorp.

A new corporation that is helping the underworld and villains by selling them weapons, vehicles, super-powered lackeys and even by createing full fledge villains.

224149.description:
Deadball is a fast-paced baseball game for one or two players that uses real statistics and RPG dice to bring the ballpark to your tabletop. In fifteen or twenty minutes, simulate a full game between real or imaginary teams, using an elegantly simple system that's intuitive to die-hards and casual fans alike.

For the dead of winter, for the dead of night, for when your team is dead in the water, Deadball is there.
224149.name: Deadball

224150.name: Warbands:  Bushido
224150.description:
Warbands:Bushido is no less than a classical boardgame with cards, hundreds of miniatures, dices and dozens of beautiful terrains to fight on. All the mechanics we love so much, but never had enough time to play. Now we have all these in our crossplatform (Steam, MacOS, IOS) wargame, with both multiplayer
battles boardgamers used to, and beautiful single player
scenarios.

Source: The Game Website.

224151.description:
In Seii Daimyo, each player is an aspiring Daimyo with goals to unify the shattered Japanese islands under a new, great Shogunate.

Each player has an identical set of role cards: 1 Samurai and 1 Ashigaru. Each round, players play one of these cards secretly and gain actions based on what they played, as well as what the other players chose to play.

Seii Daimyo is played over a series of five rounds. Each round, several locations are revealed from the deck, and each player plays one of their role cards face down to try to strengthen their forces and increase their control over the three islands.
224151.name: Seii Daimyo

224152.description:
In Hemloch: Dark Promenade, each of the two players heads an ancient house in the city of Hemloch. With nights that last for years and cults that await the coming sunrise, Hemloch is a peculiar city, inhabited by even more peculiar denizens. Players use these minions to assert their influence across the city, gaining control of different districts.

Hemloch: Dark Promenade is played over a series of three weeks (i.e., rounds). Each week, the players take turns playing minion cards from their hands to their avenues to gain influence, take districts, and thwart the other player's plans. At the end of three weeks, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
224152.name: Hemloch: Dark Promenade

224153.description:
Cartouche Dynasties is a kingdom-building card game with worker placement elements for two players. Each player heads a fledgling dynasty in Upper and Lower Egypt, hoping to leave their mark as the greatest dynasty. Players take turns exalting the gods of ancient Egypt to acquire new cards or play the cards they already have — or sometimes both! Players score points for the cards in their kingdom, as well as cards they have stored away as scrolls.

Cartouche Dynasties is played over a series of ages (i.e., rounds). Each age, players take turns selecting and playing God cards to the four decks to acquire or play cards. At the end of the game, players earn points for the cards in their kingdom and the cards in their scrolls. The player with the most points wins!
224153.name: Cartouche Dynasties

224154.name: Loony Bin
224154.description: A mechanical trash bin moves quickly around the room, changing directions, opening and closing its lid, players try to throw their paper balls into the bin. Each player has their own colored paper to make it easy to keep score. The first player to toss all of their paper balls into the Loony Bin is the Winner!

224155.name: Dagger by Proxy
224155.description:
From the introduction:

Dagger by Proxy is set during the 50s, 60s, 70s, and 80s. The United States and Soviet Union are waging a cold war, in which they cannot battle each other directly. Instead, they attempt to influence their global political agendas through proxies: organizations and states that will do their bidding... for a price.

User summary:

The game provides an unusual level of online (browser-based) support.

224156.name: Faith: A Companion Booklet for Twenty Pennyweights
224156.description:
From the introduction:

This booklet is a companion to the Twenty Pennyweights Role-Playing Ruleset. It covers in depth rules for faithful characters and includes:


Full Rules on Faith as a new Stat
How Faith Works
Rules for Creating Faithful Characters
Priests' Sacraments and Miracles
Clerics' Rites and Orisons
Stats for The Choirs of Heaven
Religious Relics and Artifacts

224157.name: QuestCore Interactive Character Sheet
224157.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is the interactive PDF character sheet for the QuestCore role-playing game.

User summary:

The character sheet is provided as a one-page, print-and-play document. It is provided as a fillable-form PDF than can be saved, printed, etc. The form completed basic character building operations (Attribute bonuses automatically populate to Skills, etc.

224158.name: Crisis: Spies
224158.description:
Two promo tiles that can be added to the Employee mix at the beginning of the game.

When drawn, they are assigned to the player last in the VP grid, and can be used during Production to gain money, resources or VP for their employer.

After each round, they are assigned to the player last in VP.

224159.name: Catacombs: Wyverns of Wylemuir
224159.description:
Description from the publisher:

Wyverns of Wylemuir is an expansion for Catacombs Third Edition and Catacombs & Castles. Defend the magic land of Wylemuir by riding the Wyverns that live there. The set includes eight Wyverns enabling characters such as heroes and monsters to ride them and unlock their powers. New heroes, monsters, items, rooms and warriors complement a double-side game board featuring a wooded meadow on one side and a dangerous swamp on the other. Finally new area of effect templates add new strategic elements to both base games.

224160.name: Game of Stranger
224160.description: This game was designed by Stranger & Stranger as a holiday gift.

224161.name: Nubia: Ancient Kingdoms of the Nile
224161.description:
Description from the publisher:

In 3000 BC, there are many kingdoms in ancient Egypt, but none more famous than Nubia, the Middle Kingdom of Egypt. With the Great Pyramid of Khufu and the Great Sphinx at Giza, Nubia lay along the river Nile.

In Nubia: Ancient Kingdoms of the Nile, the players are Pharaohs. They each make their own kingdom, with a Great Pyramid and a Royal family supported by nobility. By using their building skills and spending wheat, stone and wood, their kingdom rises step by step. The winner is the player with the greatest kingdom, judged on their pyramid, their nobles and their gold.

In more detail, each player places building cards in front of them, like a pyramid. Higher cards must be supported from below, and they cost more to build, with payment being made when constructed. The new step triggers production from the cards in the pyramid to the left and right, going down from the active card, so planning ahead is very important to success. Each player worships their own God, which brings them benefits. There are more than twenty types of building cards, with many combinations.

224162.name: Llamatron
224162.description:
Llamatron is a computer game written by Jeff Minter of Llamasoft, and released as shareware in 1991 for the Atari ST. The game was converted to the Commodore Amiga and MS-DOS the following year. It is very similar in gameplay to the 1982 arcade game Robotron: 2084, although filtered through Jeff Minter's distinctive style. The title screen gives the title as Llamatron: 2112.

The player controls a llama which can move on a single-screen playfield. The llama constantly fires a stream of white energy bolts in the direction it is moving. The player can 'hold' the fire direction, so that the llama can move freely whilst firing in a direction; alternatively the player can control the game with two joysticks, choosing the move and fire directions independently.

A large flock of enemies attempt to attack the llama, and must all be destroyed in order to end the wave (level) and progress to the next wave. Contact with any enemy causes instant death. These enemies, referred to in the game as grunts, take a variety of forms, ranging from boxes of Rizla cigarette papers to the Eye of Providence, taking in cans of Coca-Cola, hamburgers and cutlery along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Llamatron Llamatron]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

224163.name: Counterplays
224163.description:
Counterplays is a tile-stacking game that uses hexiamond-shaped tiles. A hexiamond is a piece composed of six congruent equilateral triangles, connected along their edges. There are 12 different hexiamonds. The game title is composed of them all (special thanks to Nathan Morse for this).

Counterplays is a brother game of Seven and Pent-Up, by the same designer. Players alternate turns placing one of their tiles according to some simple rules, trying to get the most of their pieces on the topmost layers when the game ends.

Note that some of the tiles are not symmetric, and can be placed either side up.

224164.description:
DuploLine is 4-in-a-row game that includes two different types of pieces (discs and rings). The goal for each player is to make a line of either four (or more) discs or rings of his color. DuploLine is a very tactical game derived from the designer’s more strategic DuploHex. Although both games use the same types of pieces and similar rules, the different goals and the small variations in the “adding” and “moving” mechanisms make DuploLine and DuploHex two completely separate games.

MATERIAL

- A hexagonal board with four hexagons per side
- 18 white discs and 18 black discs
- 18 white rings and 18 black rings
224164.name: DuploLine

224165.name: Beyond the Forest of Night (Pathfinder)
224165.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Beyond the Forest of Night" is the second installment of a classic fantasy adventure series called Slayers of the Great Serpent. The vision behind the Slayers of the Great Serpent series is about creating a story about heroes and their great deeds, but also about making a world that is majestic and awe-inspiring. This is a quest that requires the party to travel far beyond the lands known to them and cross half the world, witnessing many bizarre and spectacular sights and facing many dangers.

In this adventure, the heroes must cross the dangerous Snow Drake River at the only safe passage, a bridge fort that is currently besieged by an evil baroness. The lord of the keep tells them of a secret, but terribly dangerous, crossing point. The heroes also learn that the route to the port city of Syrn involves traveling through a vile and dangerous landscape known as the Swamp of Woe and Lost Hope. The only man known to have entered the swamp and returned to tell the tale is a woodsman named Byrnes, who is currently incarcerated in the infamous Prison at Burning Claw. The party may be tempted to free the unjustly held rustic in order to gain information about the horrid swamp.

After making their way through the dreadful Swamp of Woe and Lost Hope, the heroes arrive in the bustling and hectic metropolis of Syrn. They make inquiries about obtaining passage on a ship heading to the exotic east, and are told of a captain who boasts that his route through the Spice Islands and bordering lands takes him within sight of the fabled nation of Xi. However, a mysterious carnival and a slave revolt complicate matters.

224166.name: Choe Pho: Armory
224166.description:
From publisher blurb:

Choe Pho: Armory is an equipment expansion designed for use with the Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy Role-Playing Game.

In this booklet, you will find OVER 40 variant weapons with rules and descriptions detailing the common weapons used by adventurers and antagonists in the world of Choe Pho: A New World of Fantasy.

224167.name: Prestigious Variants Volume II, D-H Prestige Classes
224167.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #113 presents five prestige classes broken down as a variant multiclass as introduced in Paizo's Pathfinder UnchainedTM. This issue covers the Dragon Disciple, Duelist, Eldritch Knight, Holy Vindicator, and Horizon Walker.

224168.name: GM's Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I (Pathfinder)
224168.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your campaign lacking in verisimilitude and the cool little details that really bring the world alive in your players’ minds? Do you want to make your dungeons feel more realistic, your treasure more compelling or your overland travel more interesting?

Then GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I is for you! Packed full of tables designed to take the hassle out of running your game, GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I takes care of the little things so you can focus on the big things. GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I is a compilation of the first year’s “20 Things”. The book’s contents are available–for free–at Raging Swan Press's website.

224169.name: GM's Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I (System Neutral Edition)
224169.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your campaign lacking in verisimilitude and the cool little details that really bring the world alive in your players’ minds? Do you want to make your dungeons feel more realistic, your treasure more compelling or your overland travel more interesting?

Then GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I is for you! Packed full of tables designed to take the hassle out of running your game, GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I takes care of the little things so you can focus on the big things. GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume I is a compilation of the first year’s “20 Things”. The book’s contents are available–for free–at Raging Swan Press's website.

224170.name: GM's Miscellany: 20 Things Volume II (System Neutral Edition)
224170.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tired of your campaign lacking in verisimilitude and the cool little details that really bring the world alive in your players’ minds? Do you want to make your dungeons feel more realistic, your treasure more compelling or your overland travel more interesting?

Then GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume II is for you! Packed full of tables designed to take the hassle out of running your game, GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume II takes care of the little things so you can focus on the big things. GM’s Miscellany: 20 Things Volume II is a is a compilation of the second year’s “20 Things”.

224171.name: J'aime beaucoup ce que vous dites
224171.description:
In turn, each player asks a personal and funny question to the other players by posing one of the Question cards. The others answer by playing a card representing an image and commenting on it or not.
Then the asker gives small hearts to others : The more he gives hearts, the more he loves the answer.
The player who has his first full-hearted little tube wins the game.

224172.name: Vengeance A Star Wars Story
224172.description:
This is a fan-made Imperial adventure. The players playing as a squad of Stormtroopers in the adventure.

From the prologue:

11 Years Ago… A Stormtrooper squad led by a young officer stand outside a homestead. The young officer shouts for the family inside to come out. A teenager emerges with his hands up. His face is streaked with tears.

“Please don’t kill my family mister,” he cries.

“‘Your parents inside, child?” the officer asks.

The boy nods and a sadistic smile spreads across the officer’s face. He raises his flame thrower and sets the homestead ablaze. As his family’s screams fill the air, the young man lunges at the officer. The officer strikes the teenager with his gun butt, creating a large gash on his forehead.

“Nothing personal,” the officer shrugs to the boy. “I could have taken them alive…but I just enjoy killing too much. Nothing like the smell of traitors burning in the morning.”

224173.name: The Carstairs Incident
224173.description:
From the introduction:

Carstairs, Alberta is a tiny town - population around 3500, occupying less than 12 square kilometers. Normally, it’s a sleepy place, a town that more people pass through than stop in, as it lies 48 km north of the busy city of Calgary. It’s the kind of town where everyone knows each other, and there are no secrets.

Or so people believe. A terrible secret is soon to be unveiled, and Carstairs just may become the epicenter of the apocalypse.

User summary:

This item includes a brief introductory scenario, quick start rules, pre-generated characters, and several pages of print-and-play components.

224174.name: The Fugue System
224174.description:
Narrative rules for amnesia stories

From the introduction:

The Fugue System is a set of narrative game mechanics usually referred to as RPG rules, designed to let a group of players experience a particular type of interactive game-story.
...
Fugue is a mechanical engine that lets you construct and tell the story of a group of people who begin the story with complete amnesia, and who regain their memories of themselves, their pasts, their connections, their abilities and their secrets as the story goes on. What really differentiates it from most RPGs is that it’s built to tell a story that lasts a pre-determined amount of time, and leads to a definite ending.

224175.name: Star Wars: Eye Found It!
boardgameimplementation: Disney Eye Found It!: Hidden Picture Card Game
224175.description:
Blast off on a location-hopping adventure through the Star Wars galaxy, from Tatooine and the Death Star, to Jakku and more! Search the galaxy for over a thousand characters, starships, Droids, and artifacts in a quest to find R2-D2!

R2-D2 is lost somewhere in the galaxy and must be found! Earn points by following his hologram transmissions. The player with the most points when R2-D2 is found is the winner!

224176.name: Worst Case Scenario
224176.description:
From the introduction:

Yr achos gwaethaf - it’s an ill-defined period of time in the future.

Post-brexit, it was only a matter of time before Wales gained independence,
but the nation is less free than ever. Now not only a vassal to England, Wales is largely outsourced to a number of multinational brands who use the people and fauna of the land as test subjects for their market research.

Wales is subject to insanely complex bureaucracies, brutal weapons research,
mind control, propaganda, diseases, and, most pernicious of all, a complete collapse
of narratives, meaning that nothing can be trusted to be the same day to day. The sun rises still but everything else changes.

Wales is a land of song and poverty, dignity and gratuitous ultraviolence.

Wales is facing the worst case scenario.

224177.name: Canary Overdrive
224177.description:
A roleplaying game of high-octane cyberpunk action

From the introduction:

It’s the year 2247. London. The once proud government of the United Kingdom is nothing more than a puppet for the megacorps and the monarchy is a hazy memory.

In this world, information is everything and corporations will kill to get their hands on it. They employ hackers, security and assassins to do their dirty work. But by far the most deadly are the Canaries cybernetically-enhanced warriors adept at the art of killing.

These are the Corp Wars. You are on the front line.

224178.name: MindMush
224178.description:
From the introduction:

MindMush is the first in the Canary Overdrive: Missions series, each of which is designed to take one session to play. Missions are broken up into three acts that ramp up the adventure as the mission goes on. Each act contains one or more objectives, which offer a simple breakdown as to what the players will be doing during that act. Each act also has its own NPC recommendations for the Puppet Master to use as liberally as she likes.

The prologue sets the scene of the mission and offers the Puppet Master an insight into what has happened before the mission begins. This should not be shared with the players.

You won’t find a lot of minute detail in this book. The idea is that you and your players work together to create a thrilling story that is more about the plot than minutiae. Try not to get bogged down in the details just have fun making an action-packed experience.

224179.name: Canary Overdrive Character Sheet: Cutter
224179.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A character sheet example.

User summary:

This character sheet is intended to serve as a sample only; it does not provide a blank character sheet for general use.

224180.name: Zweihänder Early Access
224180.description:
ZWEIHÄNDER Grim & Perilous RPG is an OSR Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay loveletter/retroclone/heartbreaker released under Creative Commons License Share-Alike. It is a fantasy tabletop role-playing game, one where adventurers will:


Live in a gritty, ‘realistic’ fantasy world
Make morally grey decisions & enact vicious reprisals
Uncover insidious plots & political intrigue
Desperately fight in clandestine & open field combat
Defend themselves from injuries, madness & mutations
Take part in heart-pumping chase scenes
Venture into the wilderness & survive its perils
Encounter sanity-blasting creatures & their minions


Using the classical D100 system, with ZWEIHÄNDER RPG you will create grim characters, write perilous adventures and build low fantasy & dark fantasy campaigns. These rules are perfectly suitable to run Renaissance and medieval-styled adventures, too. You can also use this book to craft homebrew stories set in the works of Andrzej Sapkowski, George R.R. Martin, Glen Cook, Scott Lynch and other "grimdark"-inspired worlds.

This all-in-one game includes most of what you need to play: a character creation guide, game mastery rules and a bestiary brimming with creatures both fair & foul. All that’s left to gather are a few friends, pencils and a handful of dice.

ZWEIHÄNDER awaits, and the fate of your grim & perilous tale hangs in the balance!

http://www.grimandperilous.com

224181.name: Zweihänder Character Sheet
224181.description:
User summary:

This three-page character sheet is intended for print-and-play use. It is presented as a PDF form, with fields that can be entered, saved, and printed.

224182.name: Star Realms: Scenarios
224182.description: Star Realms: Scenarios is a supplemental Star Realms item that consists of twenty scenario cards. Before the start of a game, shuffle the deck of cards, then reveal one of the scenarios, which changes one or more rules — or introduces new rules — for that particular game.

224183.name: Zweihänder Pregenerated Characters
224183.description:
User summary:

The pregenerated characters are intended for demonstration game use but are suitable for general use. They present all the standard races and most of the typical Professions in the game, including:


Dwarf Bailiff
Ogre Barber Surgeon
Gnome Sellsword
Halfling Charlatan
Human Diabolist
Elf Anarchist


The characters typically are provided in a ZIP archive that also includes a blank character sheet.

224184.name: Abstract Network
224184.description: Abstract Network is a one to three player abstract card game played using only twelve special playing cards. A game with many simple yet strategic options, a game of strategy and pattern recognition. Players take turns placing cards on an imaginary square/invisible grid of four by three (4x3) with the goal of connecting cards to form their chosen symbol and preventing their opponents from connecting theirs. It is a puzzle to solve and a race to solve it first.

224185.name: Snot and Stitches
224185.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Victims of the Demon Lord

Snot and Stitches peers into the stinking and strange world of the goblins, revealing their origins and how they fit into the world. This supplement also offers detailed character creation rules to help you develop intricate backgrounds for your goblin characters, as well create a unique appearances and bizarre behaviors for goblins. Intended for players and GMs alike, Snot and Stitches is not afraid to get into the muck!

224186.name: The Jinbutsu
224186.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Jinbutsu is a class focused on using his art as a form of magic. With it, they can animate drawings, sculpt creatures that come to life, and even use music to charm or harm does around them.

This product contains two files:

A 17 page playbook containing over 20 moves, new gear, some magic items, and a compendium class
A two page character sheet for you to record your character's stats, gear, and moves.

224187.name: Tiefling
224187.description:
From publisher blurb:

Astonishing Races: Tiefling gives the tiefling a full-racial review and expansion, emulating the style of the “Core Races“ as detailed in books like the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide and others.

Astonishing Races: Tiefling aims to give players of the horned, demon-spawned humanoids immersive, world-neutral materials and support for almost any kind of play. Included are new and expanded options for alternate racial traits and subtypes, favored class options for all the base, core, hybrid, and occult classes, and three racial archetypes.

The book also has new racial rules for tiefling equipment, feats, traits, magic items, spells and more!

So if you’ve ever wanted to play a tiefling that can change her shape, The Soulsliver archetype, a twisted soul looking for redemption, or just love tieflings, Astonishing Races: Tiefling is the book for you!

224188.name: Muros y Pasillos
224188.description:
Description from the publisher:

Muros y Pasillos is a Dungeon Crawler game in which we assume the role of an Adventurer whose only objective is to get money. How much money? More than the rest for certain! To get through this mission, all players will adventure in a dungeon in search of junk that they are selling to some mystery merchants at the end of the game. Also, each will get some Special Errands asked by clients that, if they're fulfilled, will provide more profits at the end of the game.

This game is for 2 to 6 players from 10 years on with the objective of provide entertainment to a wider public with fast matches and medium- term dynamics.

Description from the publisher (Spanish):

Muros y Pasillos es un juego del género de los Dungeon Crawler, o Mazmorreo para los amigos, en el tomamos el papel de un Aventurero cuyo único objetivo es conseguir dinero. ¿Cuánto dinero? Más que el resto sin duda. Para llevar a cabo esta misión, todos los jugadores se aventuran dentro de una mazmorra en busca de chatarra para vender a unos comerciantes misteriosos al final de la partida así mismo, cada uno llevará Recados especiales pedidos por clientes que, de ser logrados, otorgan un plus de ganancias.

El juego es para 2 a 6 jugadores de 10 años en adelante y busca brindar entretenimiento a un público más amplio, con partidas más ágiles y dinámicas de media duración.

224190.name: Absinthe Waves
224190.description:
From the introduction:

Gracia Namata is a music journalist for Melody King Magazine. She’s in Draytonage, home village of rock legend Sullivan Hook who died early this year, shortly after the long anticipated album “Unkind Mysteries” was released to a lukewarm reception.

224191.name: A Moment of Your Time
224191.description:
From the introduction:

Alex H. Crenshaw [is] the mayor of Sealand. Alex is up for re-election this year. Alex is out meeting local voters to build goodwill with the townspeople.

224192.name: Beast of Bladenboro
224192.description:
From the introduction:

Dogs and goats are being killed in a small Southern town. Is it someone just concealing moonshining, or something more sinister?

224193.name: Breath of Life
224193.description:
From the introduction:

Summers stretch on forever when you’re young, but here in Orange Blossom and under this stifling heat - do you want it to?

224194.name: Torc of the Blood Kings (Supers!)
224194.description:
From publisher blurb:

A treasure hunter has uncovered a powerful, arcane artifact that was best left buried! Now, unwillingly transforming into a violent mutant overlord, he poses a dangerous dilemma to the heroes: will they let him suffer the consequences of his actions, or face the ire of the Blood Kings upon themselves?

224195.name: Bringing New Life
224195.description:
From the introduction:

Kim Thatcher [is] an administrator, who is pacing the halls eagerly awaiting the birth of her first children — twins!

224196.name: Catch of the Day
224196.description:
From the introduction:

Joanna Podlaska is a well-educated and ambitious thirty-something steelworks engineer. Since she was employed she was met with dismissive sexist attitudes and ostracism from colleagues. To remedy the situation the company manager in no uncertain terms requested Joanna's two closest coworkers to include her in their upcoming fishing trip, hoping to promote camaraderie. Joanna is determined to make an impression despite the challenge of being a woman in a traditionally exclusively masculine environment, both at work and during this trip. Her main source of strength is his confidence in rationality, technology and her problem-solving skills, but during the trip she might be a little intimidated by her seniors.

224197.name: Cold Steel
224197.description:
From the introduction:

Tomek Zbylski, a junior machinist in the Ostrowiec Steel Mill. Even that the work is hard, and the pay is poor, he stays here in hopes in joining the Polish underground that is said to somehow operate on the premises under the watchful eye of the Nazis.

224198.name: Codenames: Bonus Pack – Board Gaming (English)
224198.description:
Found in Spielbox Issue 1-2017 English Edition.

Bonus Pack contains 10 double-sided cards with terms based on typical board gaming words and lingo.

Euro/Family
Roleplay/Chance
Mini/Author
Expansion/Strategy
Geek/Cube
Tile/Party
Turn/Review
Loss/Token
Illustrator/Victory
Analysis/Paralysis

224199.name: Ghost Ship
224199.description:
From the introduction:

Binta Martinez, a search and rescue worker for the UN Space Guard (like the coast guard, but in space). She is driven to turn unsafe things safe and she makes friends easily. Binta and her partner Simon Kim are answering a garbled distress call from the derelict generation ship Ravana.

224200.name: Blood Will Out
224200.description:
From the introduction:

O detta Ferri is only in her third day working at the Hospital Sant’Antonio Abate in Tolmezzo. Having previously excelled during her training as a surgeon in Napoli, she’s come even further North to escape the social pressures of her family and their expectations. Her objective is to heal the sick whilst enjoying an independent life.

224201.name: No Safety From the Sand
224201.description:
From the introduction:

Taderfit, a fourteen year old Berber girl. She has lived her entire life in the town, the youngest of many siblings. Her days are filled with a little schooling, some chores and helping at her father’s market stall. She has a talent for languages and speaks limited French and Italian, picked up for foreigners passing through the bazaar.

224202.name: Dead Ashes Burn Again
224202.description:
From the introduction:

Colonel Song , senior detective in the Peking police. He is responding to a report that the mutilated body of a teenager has been found close to the old city walls.

224203.name: Porridge
224203.description:
From the introduction:

Adam Reese is a 29 year old prisoner at Green Hill serving 2 years for receiving stolen goods. Adam was low on the gang’s hierarchy and mitigated his sentence by testifying against the ringleaders. Adam Reese is not his name.

224204.name: Rare Antiquities
224204.description:
From the introduction:

Roger Dabness, a reptilian old bachelor on an extended hiatus from his position as a History and Classics Professor at Edinburgh University. Ostensibly in Brighton to scatter his mother’s ashes over the decrepit remains of the West Pier, where she met his father in the late thirties, Roger has found his plan scuppered by the partial collapse of the pier in a recent storm. He’s still carrying around the ashes in a zip-locked plastic bag he keeps inside his briefcase at all times.

224205.name: Ride a White Horse
224205.description:
From the introduction:

Eleanor Farmer, a thirteen-year-old girl who has run away to join the circus, stowing away in a wagon when the circus left her town. Her personality trait is curiosity and her source of strength is independence of spirit.

224206.name: James Shelton Mine
224206.description:
From the introduction:

Is the James Shelton Mine suffering bad luck, haunted, sabotaged, or something more serious?

224207.name: The Heart Line
224207.description:
From the introduction:

Ayan Lee is a tourist on an extended layover in the city-state of Autonexia, where many travellers break their trans-continental travel. His final destination is the old country where he hopes to meet up with distant family. His strength is streetwise, and his personality is headstrong.

224208.name: The Huston Veil
224208.description:
From the introduction:

Candle works evenings, carrying a torch to light the way for local London pedestrians (a role historically known as a “link-boy” or “Glym Jack”). Candle currently works the area between the East India Docks on the River Thames, and the East India House. Despite earning a meager subsistence, Candle feels great empathy for others, and often keeps tabs on familiar clients in case they need a hand. Edony, an older sibling who was more like a parent, died shielding Candle with their body when their ramshackle slum collapsed, and Candle has always sought to earn that sacrifice. The beatific smile on Edony’s pale and bleeding lips has served Candle like a warm beacon through dark nights, tough times, and temptation, encouraging Candle to do the right thing in Edony’s memory.

224209.name: The Last Hours of the International Space Station
224209.description:
From the introduction:

Major Zhang Wei is a Chinese Taikonaut and electrical engineer, leader of the rescue mission and hoping for the opportunity to demonstrate his heroism.

His emergency training allows him to deal calmly with stressful situations; and like many who travel into space, he has a large number of personal superstitions for luck.

224210.name: The Wilder Parts of the Forest
224210.description:
From the introduction:

Mr. Armitage, one of the Wardens of The Wilder Parts of the Forest. Mr. Armitage is a faun, having the body of a man, but the legs and tale of a goat and two horns on his forehead, one of which is snapped off two inches before the tip. Armitage served the Usurper as a spy and kidnapper during the occupation, which still haunts him to this day. His source of strength comes from his need to assuage his guilt; his experiences during the occupation have left him a morose but dutiful alcoholic. Armitage has been tasked with solving the disappearance of Edwin and Ruan Goodis, a badger prospector and his young son, missing from their home for over a week.

224211.name: Under a Grey Sun
224211.description:
From the introduction:

The scientist Lobiah Crayn has travelled to the Citadel to present their evidence of another planet. Their audience has been postponed over and again, and they have been left to their own devices for weeks to wander the Citadel. Their strength is belief that there is another place; their personality trait is ascetic.

224212.description:
The threat of Communist infiltration is at an all-time high, and red panic is everywhere. It's on you, trusted patriots of the FBI, to scour the files of any and all that may be promoting the Soviet agenda and threatening these sacred shores. The nation trusts you to detect, then publicly accuse and deport these traitors. But watch out because double agents are everywhere! Even your closest colleagues
are not to be trusted.

Perhaps even you have something to hide…

Red Scare is a hidden role/social deduction game with a delightful wrinkle; the only way to discover the truth about your friends is with a pair of secret decoder glasses! The game features no player elimination, so everyone is in on it until the end.
224212.name: Red Scare

224213.name: Colorow
224213.description:
Family-friendly strategic color-matching card game. Match colors to create rows, working to find combinations that allow you to lay all of your cards down while preventing your opponents from doing the same. Be the first to play all of your cards and you win.

Game is compact, making it easy to transport and simple instructions make it a quick learn.

224215.name: Numberline
224215.description: Card based trivia game. Be the first to create a 10-card-long numberline by making educated guesses on anything from history to pop culture to science. Can also be played solitaire style.

224216.name: A Trio of Subclasses
224216.description:
From the document:

This document presents playtest options for the monk, the paladin, and the ranger.
…
At 3rd level, a monk gains the Monastic Tradition feature. Here is a playtest option for it: the Way of the Drunken Master.
…
At 3rd level, a paladin gains the Sacred Oath feature. Here is a playtest option for it: the Oath of Redemption.
…
At 3rd level, a ranger gains the Ranger Archetype feature. Here is a playtest option for it: the Monster Slayer.

224217.name: Beyond the Pit
224217.description:
From the back cover:

The world of Titan is a dangerous place, filled with monsters, animals, constructs and demons of all kinds.

The original Out of the Pit book brought you 250 of these monsters, although this barely contained the most common! Now, we bring you another 250 dangerous and intriguing denizens of Titan.

Whether using this book to provide adversaries for Advanced Fighting Fantasy heroes or simply as a companion as you pit your skill against the Fighting Fantasy gamebooks, the descriptions and illustrations herein will prove invaluable in your travels through the world of Fighting Fantasy.

224218.description:
Description from the publisher:

April O’Neil, gutsy and independent ally of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, is getting a premiere hero pack upgrade from Kevin Wilson, the same creator of the critical hit, TMNT: Shadows of the Past board game.

Continue past the plot of the original base game, TMNT: Shadows of the Past, with an all-new Adventure Comic that features 4 new Battle Scenarios not available in any of the box-set TMNT base game versions.

Includes:
1 Exclusive Variant Cover Kevin Eastman TMNT Comic Book
1 Exclusive new April O’Neil sculpted figure
3 Action dice
7 cards
1 Hero Sheet featuring new April art from Tony Vargas
1 Adventure Comic that spans the 4 new Battle scenarios.

The expansion includes April’s action dice, which features a double shuriken and two chi faces, making her a powerful long-range fighter. Additionally, the pack includes 7 action cards such as First-Aid, which allows her to heal the Turtles, the boot-shaking Gravity Gauntlet, that both inflicts damage to opponents and knocks them back, and the Stealth Suit, which, when worn, makes it incredibly hard for enemies to see, and therefore hit April.
224218.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past Hero Pack – April O'Neil

224219.name: Bio-Logic
224219.description:
Description from the publisher:

Just beneath the surface, where few are brave enough to venture, there is a war raging out of control. You are a biologically engineered "Super-Bug", and must fight for survival. Dive inside the human body to experience the combative microcosm inside all of us.

Basic Overview

Bio-Logic is a fast-paced, hybrid tile-placement/dungeon crawler game that allows 2-6 players to infect and manipulate the world around them for ultimate domination. 6 unique "Super-Bugs" are pitted against one another in a battle to the death, inside the human body. Your goal is to infect as much of the body as possible to bulk up and destroy all the other invasive "Bugs". Ensure your survival by utilizing choice character development, performing infection combat, and strategizing tile placement and manipulation. The game's system is balanced enough for anyone to jump in. At the same time, its deep enough to offer, nearly, infinite potential for strategy. In Bio-Logic, resources are limited and foes are many, so you must adapt and evolve or you will certainly fade away.

Unique Character Development

All players begin with a choice of initial stat bonus and 1 of 6 special inherent traits. These traits can grant special boosts and bonus rewards, manipulate player or enemy stats, or protect oneself from the reactive world placement. Every "Bug" has its own advantage and strategy, and it's up to you to put that to maximum use. In addition, players can evolve new abilities based on specific board tiles.

Combat/Infecting....Vs. World, Vs. Players

Developing ones "Bug", involves infecting the world around you for stat boosting rewards. Some tiles are infected instantly. However, greater rewards are reserved for those who attempt to infect the vital organs, or enemy tiles, through combat. There are 3 levels of tiles for a player to choose from as they grow. Each tier offers greater obstacles but with greater rewards for the victor.

Players also have the option of combating one another to steal resources and abilities. Some "bugs" are better made for this than others. You can use this feature to sabotage the lead players advance, steal your favorite choice abilities, or monopolize tile type. Bio-Logic is all about choice and strategy, but you must push forward at all costs, for hesitation will bring only certain defeat.

Tile-Placement/World Manipulation

While building your character and fighting for resources, the human you infect is also attempting to eradicate you. Special enemy tiles have the ability to instantly alter many in-game stats. But it's not totally out of your control, you have a choice in how you reveal the board. The way you place tiles plays a big role in how the game progresses. Some enemies have effects that can activate as soon as the tile is put into play, while others wait until they are infected to cause a reaction. Not only does your development need attention, but so does the evolving world in which you live. Bio-Logic is always changing and you must learn to adapt if you are to survive.

Final Words

Bio-Logic takes you into an environment unlike any other. With 3 random draw piles, choice tile placement, special abilities, and limited resources no game is ever the same. On any given turn you must make decisions that affect the entire game world, altering everyone's future. It's a delicate dance where you must evaluate every aspect of development to ultimately claim victory over your friends. In Bio-logic, you must master your universe or get wiped from existence.

224220.description:
Description from the designer:

Trilobites are among the most successful animals to ever live on Earth, lasting for over 250 million years and spanning the globe. They mostly lived on the sea floor in shallow oceans, but some varieties lived in deeper water and on land in tidal regions. They were highly diversified in physiology, habitat, and behavior – ranging from inches to feet in length, some foraging, some hunting, some filter feeding, and some grazing. Their closest living relative is the Horseshoe Crab, but all true trilobites went extinct by the end of the Permian.

Trilobite Dice recreates competition between different strains of trilobites as they populate the ocean shallows. It is a cross between connection games (like Hex, Twixt, or Gonnect) and tactical dice games (like Roll Through the Ages, Octo Dice, or Pandemic: The Cure). It can be played competitively with 2 players or solo against an automated ‘imposter’. Trilobite Dice is a print-and-play game, using consumable sheets of paper each game.

Players take turns rolling and rerolling special dice. The results of the dice provide resources to be allocate towards various special effects, including once-per-game bonus effects, ongoing special powers, and additional dice to roll on future turns. The players use these effects and powers to populate a hex map with their species, aiming to connect two opposite sides of the board before their opponent does so. Some effects, such as buying extra dice, increase a player’s hunger rating, which must be overcome before the player can win, so players must balance multiple objectives. The primary form of interaction between players is on the hex board, but some special powers create additional forms of interaction and alternate win conditions. The game can be played in basic form, with just 20 special effects available, or advanced form with over 50 special effects to choose from (including more complex powers that combine to support additional tricks and strategies).
224220.name: Trilobite Dice

224221.name: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain
224221.description:
From the back cover:

Deep below Firetop Mountain is a dungeon. A very special dungeon.

For here resides the Warlock, an evil magician of immense power, protected by guards, traps and monsters. A group of special Heroes are needed to defeat the Warlock and free the surrounding countryside of his malign influence.

Based upon the classic gamebook and featuring original and new illustrations, this adventure will challenge and entertain your players!

224223.name: Change Our Vile Bodies
224223.description:
From the introduction:

Constance Young, a trainee journalist from Manchester. Her brother, Lionel, has dropped out from university, cut off contact with his family and joined a hippie commune in Devon. Constance wants to re-establish communications with Lionel.

224224.name: Darkness Visible
224224.description:
From the introduction:

Gregory Freeman, would-be writer. Has come to Deacon Fork to research his family history, for a planned book. His strength is stubborn determination, and his personality trait is a charming demeanor.

224225.name: Dark Pledges
224225.description:
From the introduction:

Dana Williams, a savvy business major sophomore whose boyfriend Trevor was a member of the Alpha Delta Sigma fraternity on the campus of North Star University. Dana is a young black woman with a very professional style and a penchant for heels.

224226.name: Doll Baby
224226.description:
From the introduction:

Flavia Kingston, PhD candidate and porcelain artist writing her dissertation on dolls of the late 19th and early 20th century. Flavia has accepted an internship to catalog and restore new items in the Greenwich Museum of New England Life’s famed Emily L. Greenleaf Collection of Bisque and Porcelain Dolls.

224227.name: House-Sitter
224227.description:
From the introduction:

Olivia Kirk, a freelance production assistant who has been asked to house-sit by Marvin Tennenbaum, a big-shot movie producer. Her source of strength is knowing that if she fucks this gig up, she’ll be stuck doing post on cheesy celebrity haunting shows for the rest of her career.

224228.name: Mr. Giggles Comes to Dinner
224228.description:
From the introduction:

Alex is a devoted single parent struggling to raise their child, Sam. They would do anything for Sam, and draw on their love for Sam whenever they need strength. Recently Sam has acquired an imaginary friend they call Mr. Giggles. Mr. Giggles has been the culprit in a series of capers involving Sam and their friend Robin. A chemist at the local chemical plant, Alex relies on their background as a scientist to rationalize the strange happenings around them.

224229.name: On Ilkla Moor Baht'at
224229.description:
From the introduction:

Effie Williams is a 12 year old girl from London. Her little brother, David, was killed in the Blitz and 3 months ago she was sent to the village of Ben Rhydding at the edge of Ikley Moor. Effie’s source of strength is a sense of adventure, her personality trait is “goes unnoticed”.

224230.name: Resonate
224230.description:
From the introduction:

Luis Alvarez, a former soldier of a quasi-military governmental organisation that fought to suppress Mythos threats. After a failed operation, the force was disbanded.
